name: Introduction to Change Management E-Learning
description:
Description: Introduction to Change Management
Establishing a shared understanding of what change management is and how it contributes to project success can help align project team members and ultimately drive project success. This eLearning module introduces the foundational tenets of change management, which is a discipline for managing the people side of change. Participants will learn about the importance of change management as they apply these tenets to a real project.

WHO IS THIS eLEARNING MODULE FOR?
This module is designed for Associates, leaders, project managers, project team members, and anyone who needs to understand the “why” and “what” of change management. Because this module presents the five foundational tenets of change management, practitioners can use this model to introduce change management to anyone—regardless of their prior change management knowledge—and drive clarity and alignment. 

OUTCOMES AND LEARNING OBJECTIVES
During this module, participants will:
•	Articulate the internally and externally driven reasons for a specific change
•	Identify which groups will be impacted by a specific change and how
•	Understand how change management contributes to overall benefit realization and why it is important to their organization
•	Evaluate their project’s current health in the categories of change management, project management, and leadership/sponsorship

EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING
 Participants will select a specific project they are currently involved in and reflect on this change throughout the module. After each section, participants will apply what they have learned to their project. They will also assess the health of their project using the Prosci PCTTM Assessment. At the end of the module, participants will receive a downloadable report of their responses, including their PCT Assessment results, to reference after completing the module.

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com

name: Introdution to Leading Change E-Learning
description:
Description:
Introduction to Leading Through Change
Managers play a key role in driving organizational change by being effective change leaders. The Introduction to Leading Change eLearning module gives managers a framework to use when adapting to change themselves and introduces the five research-based roles they need to fulfil to successfully lead change with their Associates.

WHO IS THIS eLEARNING MODULE FOR?
This module is designed for any manager who leads other people. Through this virtual learning module, participants will understand that they are a critical enabler of organizational change and the importance of preparing themselves for change before leading change.
Participants will reflect on the changes happening within their organization and will learn how to view these changes through the lens of the Prosci ADKAR® Model.
Participants will then learn the five research-based roles of a manager during change and how fulfilling these roles
will to help their Associates progress through the ADKAR® Model. Throughout the module, participants will follow
the example story of Anne, a Client Services Manager at Finesta Financial, to see these five roles in action before
reflecting on their own change.
The five roles participants will learn about are: Communicator, Liaison, Advocate, Resistance Manager, and Coach.

OUTCOMES AND LEARNING OBJECTIVES
During this forty-five minute virtual module, participants will:
• Understand that they have a significant impact on the success of change in their organization
• Learn how to overcome their own barriers to change and how to help their Associates overcome their barriers
• Develop techniques they can use to fulfil the five specific roles of an effective change leader
• Prepare to have a change conversation with an Associate
• Reflect on how to prepare themselves to adapt to and lead a current change


EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING
Participants will select a specific change happening in their workplace and reflect on this change throughout the module. Participants will use their own ADKAR® profile to plan how to prepare themselves for their selected change. They will then prepare to fulfil the five roles of a manager during this change by reflecting on questions related to each role.
The module concludes with a downloadable output of the participant’s responses that they can reference as they begin leading change with their team.

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: Great Place to Work – Office – IMG 0641 (1).jpg

name: Thriving Through Change E-Learning
description:
Description: Thriving Through Change

Associates experience change in their own individual ways, and how they transition through change
depends on their sense of ownership for the change. The Thriving Through Change eLearning module will help
people prepare themselves for change, providing action steps that can be followed to move through change
successfully.

WHO IS THIS eLEARNING MODULE FOR?
This module is designed for any associate facing change in an organization. Through this virtual
learning module, participants will learn that they have the power to be proactive in their change experience.
Participants will reflect on the changes happening in their organizations. They will explore their emotional
reactions to change and plan for how to manage their feelings. Using the Prosci ADKAR® Model, participants
will evaluate a current change and learn specific actions they can take to increase their acceptance of
a change. Participants will also hear about David and Jorge, two example characters who approach a change
in very different ways, to guide their own actions.

OUTCOMES AND LEARNING OBJECTIVES
• During this module, participants will:
• Understand that change is a process, and organizational change depends on each person making a transition
• Identify the normal emotional reactions to change and how they influence a person’s experience with change
• Pinpoint where they are in a current change process and understand what could hold them back from being successful
• Plan actionable steps to engage in a current change and begin to take control of their experience

EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING
Participants will select a specific change happening in their workplace and reflect on this change throughout the module. Participants will use their own emotional reflection and ADKAR® profile to plan how to prepare themselves for their selected change. They will then learn specific tactics to help raise their ADKAR® levels
to be successful with change.
The module concludes with a downloadable output of the participant’s responses that they can reference throughout their current change and any future changes.

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: Great Place to Work – Office – IMG 0212 (1).jpg

name: Managing Through Change (0 Getting Started) E-Learning
description:
Audience: Line Mangers

Description:
Managing Through Change is a self-guided digital learning journey for Managers at Mars. It provides a curated suite of guidance, tools and resources to support Managers to effectively manage through change. The learning journey is underpinned by the Prosci change management methodology and is comprised of 5 modules: 
0 Getting Started, 
1 The Essentials, 
2 Preparing for Change, 
3 Managing Change
4 Reinforcing Change. 
Depending on a Manager's level of experience and desire to learn, they can either guide themselves through the learning journey as an end-to-end deep dive learning experience, or dip in and out, drawing on specific tools and guidance as and when they need it. This module, 0 Getting Started, provides an overview of the entire learning journey and walks through 'what', 'why' and 'how' to use it.

This course focuses on the practice of crystallizing intent within the High Performance Collaboration (HPC) framework. It helps team members and leaders clarify their intentions and objectives to ensure effective collaboration.

By the end of this course, participants will be able to:
-Understand the importance of crystallizing intent in collaboration.
-Apply techniques to effectively communicate and clarify their intentions in a team.

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: GLM High Performance Collaboration (HPC) Crystalize Intent E-Learning .png

name: GLM High Performance Collaboration (HPC): Cultivate Collaboration E-Learning
description:
Description
This course module, "GLM High Performance Collaboration (HPC): Cultivate Collaboration," is designed to help Associates learn how to cultivate collaboration within their teams. The module focuses on establishing specific commitments and expectations among team members and the leader, fostering a collaborative environment.

By the end of this course, participants will be able to:
-Understand the importance of cultivating collaboration within a team.
-Learn to establish clear commitments and expectations among team members and the leader.
-Develop the skills needed to promote effective collaboration.
-Create a collaborative work environment that enhances team performance.

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: GLM High Performance Collaboration (HPC) Cultivate Collaboration E-Learning.png

name: GLM High Performance Collaboration (HPC): Activate Ways of Working (AWOW) E-Learning
description:
Description
This course module, "GLM High Performance Collaboration (HPC): Activate Ways of Working (AWOW)," focuses on establishing efficient ways of working to support the shared commitments of the team. It is aimed at enhancing collaborative efforts among team members and leaders.

By the end of this course, participants will be able to:
-Learn to establish efficient ways of working within a team.
-Understand the importance of supporting shared commitments.
-Develop skills for collaborative and productive teamwork.
-Enhance leadership abilities in the context of team projects.

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: GLM High Performance Collaboration (HPC) Activate Ways of Working (AWOW) E-Learning.png

name: GLM High Performance Collaboration (HPC): Sustain & Renew E-Learning
description:
Description
This course module, "GLM High Performance Collaboration (HPC): Sustain & Renew," focuses on supporting the "Sustain & Renew" practice. This practice encourages teams to continue evolving through inquiry, reflection, and feedback to deliver full value.

Learning Objectives:
-Learn the principles of the "Sustain & Renew" practice.
-Understand the importance of inquiry, reflection, and feedback.
-Develop skills to enhance team collaboration and performance.
-Achieve the ability to consistently deliver full value within the team.

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: GLM High Performance Collaboration (HPC) Sustain & Renew E-Learning.png

name: GLM High Performance Collaboration (HPC): Clarify Context E-Learning
description:
Description
This module supports the Clarify Context practice that helps teams manage change and transition, in order to adapt and modify their collaboration to suit changing circumstances. This practice is only used during times of significant change.

By the end of this course, participants will be able to:
-Manage change and transition effectively within their teams.
-Adapt and modify collaboration practices to suit changing circumstances during significant changes.

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: GLM High Performance Collaboration (HPC) Clarify Context E-Learning.png

tags: GLM
name: GLM Introduction to Delivering Effective Feedback E-Learning
description:
Description
This course provides a concise learning experience focused on delivering effective feedback. As a Line Manager, you frequently have the opportunity and responsibility to provide feedback to your Associates and peers. The way you deliver feedback can have a profound impact. If you want to learn how to get started on the right foot with delivering great feedback, join this interactive digital learning.

By the end of this course, participants will have a better understanding of delivering effective feedback by learning how to apply the TRAIN method (Task, Result, Action/Inaction).

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: GLM Introduction to Delivering Effective Feedback E-Learning.png

tags: GLM
name: GLM Introduction to Coaching E-Learning
description:
Description
This course offers a concise learning experience focused on coaching, a complex and important behavior for Line Managers at Mars. If you're looking for insights on how to get started with coaching your Associates, jump into this interactive digital learning.

By the end of this course, participants will have a better understanding of how to apply the GROW model with their employees by exploring their G (Goals), R (Reality), O (Options), W (What Actions to Take).

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com

name: GLM The difference between Mentoring and Coaching E-Learning
description:
Description
This course offers a concise introduction regarding the distinction between mentoring and coaching. Both related but distinct behaviors are important for Great Line Managers. Mentoring conversations are action-driven; coaching conversations are reflection-driven.

By the end of this course, participants will have a better understanding of when and how you approach coaching and mentoring.

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: GLM The difference between Mentoring and Coaching E-Learning.png

name: Design for Vertical Startup for Process 2 E-Learning
description:
Audience: R&D associates and any associate involved in a project where the Design for Vertical Startup process roadmap will be used.

This modular E-Learning gives a thorough overview of the complete Design For Vertical Startup (DfVS) for Process roadmap. It introduces the four stages of the process: study, design, execution and commissioning, validation, and start-up phase. Completion of this E-Learning is a mandatory pre-requisite for taking part in the Virtual Classroom DfVS Process 3 training.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Recognize purpose and key benefits of the DfVS for Process approach
-Identify the mandatory steps of the DfVS for Process Roadmap
-Explain project process flow through key inputs and outputs

Prerequisites: Design for Vertical Startup for Process 1 E-Learning (Essential)

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: Design for Vertical Startup for Process 2 E-Learning.png

name: Design for Vertical Startup for Product And Pack 1 E-Learning
description:
Audience: Associates who are interested to learn how we develop new products and packaging from ideas and prototypes.

Description:
In this course, you will walk through the Design for Vertical Startup (DfVS) for product and packaging development roadmap with a fictional team who are working on a new biscuit. You'll find out more about the process, the people who are involved and the tools that help you design and implement your product.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Explain the role of the DfVS in the Mars Product Lifecycle Management process; and
-Understand the purpose and the deliverables at the steps of the DfVS for Product and Pack process.

Prerequisites: None
Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: Design for Vertical Startup for Product And Pack 1 E-Learning.png

name: Design for Vertical Startup for Process 1 E-Learning
description:
Audience: Associates who are interested to learn how we translate new product ideas into reality within our factories.

Description:
In this program associates will be introduced to the Vertical Start-Up Roadmap (VSR). The VSR has been created to enable ‘right first time’ process design and implementation within our factories.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Describe the Vertical Start-up Roadmap (VSR) approach;
-Describe the importance of a cross-functional team and which functions are involved; and
-Identify how the roadmap will benefit them and the business.

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: Design for Vertical Startup for Process 1 E-Learning.png

name: Design for Vertical Startup for Process 3 Virtual
description:
Audience: All associates involved in process projects that follow the DfVS roadmap.

Description:
This series of three virtual training sessions builds on the details covered in the DfVS for Process 2 E-Learning, by engaging participants in case studies and other material to deepen their knowledge and enable learners to effectively participate in projects running the DfVS process road map.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
Recognize the purpose and key benefits of the DFVS for Process approach.
Identify the mandatory Study stage steps of the DFVS for Process Roadmap.
Explain, through real Mars project examples, project process flow through key inputs and outputs.
Prerequisites
Design for Vertical Startup for Process 1 E-Learning (Essential)
Design for Vertical Startup for Process 2 E-Learning (Essential)

Modern Browser, Individual Computer, Headset

name: External Manufacturing Quality Management (EMQM) Secondary Co-Packing Virtual
description:
Audience: External Manufacturing Quality Assurance Associates / QiD Associates managing secondary copacking

Description: 
This course describes the External Manufacturing Quality Management process to be used for the development and quality management of Secondary Copackers. It establishes the key principles,steps through the four steps of the process and uses examples to reinforce the learning. On completion of the course, learners should be able to: - recognize the benefits of the EMQM in their job role and to Mars Inc - understand the governing principles of EMQM and how they apply - describe the four steps of the EMQM process and describe the criteria of Secondary Co-Packer status - clarify how the outputs of the EMPRA (EM Product Risk Assessment) are used to define the risk management strategy - utilise tools & the global EMQM Community to ensure a robust implementation of EMQM in their area of responsibility.

Technical Information/ Requirements: Modern browser, personal laptop, personal headset with microphone
Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: Great Place to Work – Office – IMG 0641 (1).jpg

name: External Manufacturing Quality Management (EMQM) Virtual
description:
Audience: This course is for associates at all levels of the organization performing a role in the development or management of External Manufacturers from across Supply, Commercial and R&D. External Manufacturers include co-manufacturers, co-packers and licencing operations.
Roles include EMQA, Buying (C&MTT), Supply (Planning), Logistics, R&D Product, Process and Packaging Development and Q&FS.

Description:
The course describes the External Manufacturing Quality Management process to be used for the development and quality management of Co-Manufacturers, Co-Packers and licensees. It establishes the key principles, walks your through the four steps of the process and uses examples to reinforce the learning.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Understand the principles and steps of the External Manufacturing Quality Management Process;
-Recognize the benefits of the EMQM in their job role and to Mars Inc.;
-Be able to describe the criteria of External Manufacturer (EM) status;
-Understand how the outputs of the EMPRA are used to define the risk management strategy; and
-Understand the tools available Utilize tools & the global EMQM community to ensure a robust implementation of EMQM in their area of responsibility.

Technical Information/ Requirements: Modern browser, personal laptop, personal headset with microphone
Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com

name: The Quality Management Process (QMP) Virtual
description:
Audience: All associates who own, manage or maintain an QMP business process

Description: 
This engaging and interactive training supports Associates in the development of ESSENTIAL level competence allowing trained Associates to understand the requirements of the Mars Global QMP Framework Standard and effectively apply it in their areas of responsibility.

Having completed the training Mars Associates will have a clear understanding of key components of the QMP Standard and their accountabilities and responsibilities.

Technical Information/ Requirements: Modern Browser, Individual Computer, Headset.
Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com

name: MSE E&T Training Effectiveness Blended
description:
This program will take you through how to successfully implement Training Effectiveness at your site. After completed it, you will be able to:

State the reasons of implementing training effectiveness process and the importance to site business.
Describe all 4 levels of training effectiveness evaluation methods, tools and requirements correctly and clearly.
Apply right training effectiveness evaluation level and tools to given training program and collect evaluations feedbacks efficiently.
Analyze evaluations results and feedbacks as inputs for verifying contribution to loss reduction and improving training activities accordingly.
Apply the Training Effectiveness Process to verify training activity result and actual loss reduction linked to the site CBN.

Technical Information/ Requirements: Modern Browser, Individual Computer, Headset.
Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: Great Place to Work – Office – IMG 1132.jpg

name: SIG Foundations Blended
description:
Audience: Supply Anchor Role, R&D Associate

Description:
This program enables Associates to understand the Mare Inc. Sustainable in a Generation (SiG) strategy and how to deploy it at our sites and within their normal roles. The course covers the SiG sub-strategies of Opex/Capex/New Technology and Renewable Energy. Our SiG targets are explained. Sections on fossil energy, green house gases, water and waste explore practical approaches to improve our performance and engage associates in the challenge of transforming our sites to be sustainable.

This course was built internally within MSE Academy.

Technical Information/ Requirements: Modern Browser, Individual Computer, Headset.
Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com

name: Food Defense Team Leader Virtual
description:
Audience: cross-segment Q&FS, Food Defense Team Leaders

Description:
This material is designed to provide competency to the level required by Food Defense Qualified Individual (FDQI) Training by being at least equivalent to the training provided in the curriculum used in the FSPCA training. It covers:
-The difference between accessibility and vulnerability
-Conducting a vulnerability assessment (including use of the Key Activity Types method)
-Preparation of the Food Defense Plan
-Identification and explanation of the mitigation strategies
-When a reanalysis should be conducted
The material also incorporates all of the Food Defense Foundation Level material and explains the expected outcomes of Food Defense Foundation Level Training and the Responsibilities of Food Defense Team Leaders for the delivery of Food Defense Foundation Level Training.

Technical Information/ Requirements: Modern Browser, Individual Computer, Headset.
Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: Great Place to Work – Office – IMG 0535.jpg

name: Auditing at Mars (External Suppliers) Virtual
description:
Audience: Global & cross segment, SQA, EM, QiD Technologists & Managers

Description:
Carrying out Audits at sites external to Mars is a core part of the Supplier Quality Assurance, External Manufacturing and Quality in Distribution Roles and being able to do this professionally, in line with our standards and guidelines is very important to help ensure Mars' supply chain is properly protected and risks are managed effectively. In this program, learners will learn how to carry out process style audits, focusing on the findings and develop audit plans for their category. This new auditing method aligns with the GFSI audit scheme which is consistent with Mars' internal and external audit program. The Auditing at Mars (External Suppliers) training is mandatory for all SQA, EM and QiD auditors. The course consists of 9 hours of facilitator led training with 1 hr of team homework and 1 hr of individual homework

Technical Information/ Requirements: Modern Browser, Individual Computer, Headset.
Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com

name: Complex Problem Solving Foundations E-Learning
description:
Audience: Scientists, engineers, technicians or any associate looking to solve problems by reducing process variability.

Description:
This course introduces you to the world of complex problem solving at Mars by explaining the underlying methodologies in Supply and R&D and taking you through different examples. You will see how this approach reduces the variation of any process, improving quality, efficiency and growth. The training explains the steps to follow and when to apply the approach.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Explain the difference between day-to-day problems and complex problems;
-Describe how Mars solves comples problems using the Six Sigma methodology; and
-Understand how to implement the approach in your own role.

Technical Information/ Requirements: Modern Browser, Individual Computer, Headset.
Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com

name: Food Defense Awareness E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Mars Associates & Contractors

Description:
Food Defense is one of the foundational elements of our Quality Management Program.

Learning Objectives:
-Understand what Food Defense is.
-Be able to explain why Food Defense is important.
-Understand accessibility and vulnerability and their importance in development of the site Food Defense plan.
-Know what you can and need to do to adhere to Mars Food Defense processes and policies.

Technical Information/ Requirements: Modern Browser, Individual Computer, Headset.
Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com

name: Chocolate School E-learning
description:
Audience: All Associates in Mars Wrigley Confectionery who deal with chocolate/chocolate ingredients as a key part of their role AND all other Segment associates who are interested in foundational chocolate knowledge.

Description:
By the end of this course, you will have an essentials level understanding of the history of chocolate, Mars chocolate history, raw materials of chocolate, the process of making chocolate, chocolate regulations, and how to conduct a virtual chocolate tasting.

name: Consumer Care at Mars: Introduction E-Learning
description:
Audience: This training is part of the induction for new Associates in Q&FS roles as well as for associates that need to be aware of the role Consumer Care plays at Mars.

Description:
The Consumer Care at Mars: Introduction E-Learning provides learners with an introduction to the Consumer Care job family at Mars and the Global Consumer Care Standard.
It also provides an overview of the roles at Mars that have accountabilities within Consumer Care.

By the end of this course, you will:
-Have an understanding of what Consumer Care is at Mars;
-Have an awareness of the Mars Global Consumer Care Standard; and
-Have an awareness of your accountabilities in Consumer Care within your role.

tags: Finance
name: Программа: Finance Foundations. Module 1: Growth Philosophy E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Associates

Description:
This is a Financial Foundations training series, which will help you build your financial and business knowledge. This training series includes eight foundational e-learnings and three functional-specific e-learnings to further develop the understanding of a Marketing, Brand Business Partner, and Supply Associate. 

We suggest that you take these courses in the recommended order, however, completion of the program will be based on completion of all courses.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Explain the functions of the three main financial statements we use at Mars.
Review the Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) at Mars.
-Describe the main KPIs of a Profit and Loss Statement and the drivers that influence them.
-Define the main KPIs of Cash Flow and Balance Sheet statements and why they are important.
Access and use the Mars key financial tools to analyze financial information.

Program:
Module 1: Introduction E-Learning
Module 2: Financial Statements E-Learning
Module 3: Financial KPIs and Accountability E-Learning
Module 4: Driving the Top-Line E-Learning
Module 5: Driving the Bottom-Line E-Learning
Module 6: Driving Cash E-Learning
Module 7: Digital Tools E-Learning
Module 8: Conclusion & Introduction to Veterinary Services KPIs. E-Learning

Technical Information/ Requirements: Modern Browser, Individual Computer, Headset

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com

name: Программа: Information Security. Module 1: Your Responsibility at Mars E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Associates

Module 1: Your Responsibility at Mars E-Learning. 
Description: Mars Associates are the company’s first and most powerful line of defense. Practicing good security behaviors is mutually beneficial and helps protect everyone. In this module, you will be on-boarded as a Mars Information Security Awareness Champion so that you can take an active role in:
• Believe in our vision;
• Embed our best practices, and;
• Grow our community.

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com

name: Программа: Information Security. Module 2: Protecting Your Digital Identity E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Associates

Module 2: Protecting Your Digital Identity E-Learning. 
Description: Keeping your corporate digital identity safe is important to protect the organization, its information, assets, and systems. This module will take you through steps to create strong passwords as well as other information security best practices to help keep you, your corporate digital identity, and Mars Secure Together.

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com

name: Программа: Information Security. Module 3: Device and Online Safety E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Associates

Module 3: Device and Online Safety E-Learning. 
Description: The same tools that brings such convenience also bring great risks. Those who want our data have sophisticated ways of stealing it. In this module, you will explore behaviors that, when adopted, will lead to playing a vital role in keeping our data safer in a climate where cyber-attacks have become a lucrative crime for the hacker and a true threat to our business.

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com

name: Программа: Information Security. Module 4: Preventing Email Cyber-Attacks E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Associates

Module 4: Preventing Email Cyber-Attacks E-Learning. 
Description: Social Engineering occurs when criminals digitally impersonate a trusted individual of business to get people to divulge confidential information in order to commit fraud. In this module, you will learn how to recognize the signs of suspicious emails and how to respond to them safely.

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com

name: Программа: Spark Your Engagement. Module 1: Seize your opportunity E-learning
description:
Audience: All Associates

Description:
Spark Your Engagement is a comprehensive curriculum designed for Associates as an integral component of the global onboarding program for new joiners at Mars. This curriculum serves as an introduction to our Associate Engagement concept, providing practical insights that prompt Associates to consider actionable steps toward success and engagement in the workplace. This curriculum is your gateway to a successful and engaging journey at Mars. Each module is meticulously crafted to empower Associates with the knowledge and tools needed to thrive in their roles while actively contributing to the overall culture of engagement at Mars.

The Program is made of six learning modules:
1. Seize your opportunity
2. Find your purpose
3. Be yourself
4. Get what you need
5. Manage your manager
6. Keep evolving

By the end of this program, you will be able to:
-Understand the Associate Engagement concept, exploring its significance within the Mars organizational framework.
-Reflect on personal contributions and actions for success, fostering a proactive mindset.
-Apply practical insights acquired during the course to real-world scenarios, fostering immediate relevance and application in the day-to-day work environment.
-Consistently evaluate and enhance your engagement strategies for ongoing success at Mars

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com

Technical Information/ Requirements: Modern Browser, Individual Computer, Headset

name: Программа: Strategic Revenue Managment (SRM). Module 1: Introduction E-learning
description:
This online learning module will introduce you to Strategic Revenue Management (SRM). SRM is a critical part of the Mars Growth Philosophy - it helps us enhance the value of each converted transaction we make, and impacts everyone at Mars, regardless of your role. The learning will help you understand SRM and your role in building the organizational capability as a Mars Associate.
Program:
Module 1: Introduction (E-learning) 35 minutes
Module 2: Mix for Growth (E-learning) 1 hour
Module 3: Strategic Pricing (E-learning) 1 hour
Module 4: Trade Promotions Excellence (E-learning) 1 hour
Module 5: Trade Terms Management (E-learning) 1 hour

name: Программа: Shopper Marketing for One Demand. Module 1: Overview E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Regions and Segments, associates in Brand Marketing, Customer Marketing and Sales

Description:
This course will provide clear training about how to understand and apply Customer and Shopper Marketing knowledge, terminology, and metrics to drive a ‘triple win’ . It is an engaging and interactive 40 minute eLearning that focuses on what shopper marketing is, The Triple Win mindset, Winning the Value Proposition, The Consumer Journey and Evaluating the Impact.

At the end of this E-Learning associates will:
-Understand how an efficient process will make our output more effective by….​
-Developing value solutions for the triple win – shoppers, retailers and Mars​
-Being grounded in insights​
-Communicating to the shoppers as they transition through the consumer journey​

And Will:
-Leave with clearly defined​
-Functional strengths I can be a champion for the team​
-Functional opportunities I can develop in my PDP

Стоимость: бесплатно
Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com
thumbFileUuid: Shopper Marketing for One Demand E-Learning.png

name: MSE ET Expert Trainer E-Learning
description:
Audience: Factory trainers, Supply

Description:
This course is designed to help you to understand the impact you have on building Associate capability and enable you to demonstrate your role as an expert trainer within the context of MSE.
By the end of this program you should have a better understanding of how to:
• Identify the characteristics of an exceptional trainer
• Incorporate training best practices into their training delivery
• Apply adult learning theory to drive participant engagement and learning retention
• Execute training delivery responsibilities from preparation through recordkeeping
• Support excellence by providing standardized training delivery that creates exceptional learner experiences
• Develop strategies to effectively the manage classroom
• Build an energetic, mutually supportive, expert training community

Technical Requirements: Computer

name: 2024 Продукт: от поля до полки E-Learning
description: Этот курс расскажет о том, как производится и из чего состоят рационы Royal Canin

name: Подкаст Голоса Royal Canin "Однажды в полях"
description: На связи "Голоса Royal Canin". В этом выпуске мы разберем реальную ситуацию из полей, связанную с отработкой наиболее часто встречающихся возражений. Гость выпуска- Михаил Берзин, торговый представитель PSR команды Москвы.

name: Физиология пищеварения собак и кошек. Диетотерапия E-Learning
description: Обучение для команды научной коммуникации

name: Нутриенты и их роль. Формула продукта E-Learning
description: Обучение для команды научной коммуникации

tags: Brand Knowledge, Business Insights, Marketing Strategies
name: Laws of Growth E-Learning
description:
Audience: Marketing, Sales, Customer Marketing, and CMI Associates

Description:
This course provides an overview of the foundations of how we do Marketing at Mars. Within it you will explore many of the popular myths that have grown up in marketing and also the realities of How Brands Grow. The course is a required pre-work for the face-to-face Laws of Growth training but is also useful for all during their onboarding.  This course has been collaboratively developed with Triniti Marketing.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
Understand the essential laws of growth.
Connect these laws to the process of brand growth.

tags: Food Safety Management, Quality and Food Safety at Mars, Sourcing Quality Management, Sourcing Quality Management: Food Fraud
name: Food Fraud Awareness E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Associates, especially R&D, Commercial, Legal & Sales.

Description:
This course introduces you to the basics of Food Fraud, how it happens and the risks it poses to Mars.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Describe what Food Fraud is;
-Explain why Mars is concerned with Food Fraud, including economically motivated adulteration and counterfeit products;
-Explain what Mars does to prevent it in our supply chain and markets; and
-Understand your role in the prevention strategy.

tags: Food Safety And Quality, Assurance (FSQA), Internal Controls, Quality and Food Safety at Mars, Risk Management, Sourcing Quality Management: Food Fraud
name: Food Fraud Fundamentals E-learning
description:
Audience: R&D and Commercial associates.

Description:
These Fundamental Food Fraud eLearnings build on the awareness level course to further associates understanding of food fraud risks and mitigation strategies.
The course is a pre-requisite for the Food Fraud Vulnerability Assessment Workshop.

By the end of this course, you will understand:
-The different types of food fraud and how they can impact Mars;
-Vulnerabilities;
-Mitigation strategies; and
-Food fraud plans.

Prerequisite: Food Fraud Awareness E-Learning

tags: Agile Project Management, Design Thinking, Innovation Management
name: Front End Framework (FEF) Process E-Learning
description:
Audience: Anyone following the FEF process and applying FEF principles in their work.

Description:
This module will introduce you to the Front End Framework (FEF) process.
Powered by Design Thinking, FEF is a standardized, effective and agile non-linear approach to Front End Innovation at Mars. It is used collaboratively to enable the delivery of the Mars innovation strategy.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
Explain how FEF is deployed;
Describe how it connects to Mars Product Lifecycle Management (PLM); and
Explain the scope and the FEF process within PPM, the project portfolio management system at Mars.

tags: Analysis Tools, Engineering Analysis, Internal Controls, Product Quality Conformance, Quality and Food Safety at Mars
name: Testing & Conformance Foundations E-Learning

tags: Agile
name: Agile Strategy Review E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Commercial Associates

This course aims to support associates to approach Category Strategies as dynamic conversations and challenge assumptions via an application of Agile techniques and tools to help you keep a Continuous Improvement Mindset.
This course was built internally within Agile Capability team.

Learning Objectives:
-Understand strategies as dynamic conversations, not static documentation
-Understand the value of a structured and consistent strategy review process
-Gain understanding of Inspect, Learn & Adapt and Continuous Improvement mindsets and how these can support strategy review
-Be introduced to the techniques of Agile Retrospectives, Feedback Loops, and MoSCoW Prioritization as take-away tools

tags: Commercial Operational, Excellence, Presentation skills, Project Management Stakeholder Engagement, Supply Chain Management, SCM
name: Bringing the Ensure Pillar to Life E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Commercial Associates

Description:
All Commercial Associates share responsibility for the success of Commercial programs that support each of the five pillars. In this course, we’ll focus on the Commercial-led programs aimed at ensuring we have a responsible and sustainable supply chain.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Explain the crucial role of Commercial in delivering the Sustainable in a Generation Plan.
-Describe the two signature programs under the Ensure Pillar: Next Generation Origin & Next Generation Supplier.
-Explain how we measure risks in our supply chains, and the impact of our sustainability efforts.
-Describe how Sustainability is integrated into the MSSM process.
-Be an ambassador for Commercial sustainability programs.
thumbFileUuid: Bringing the Ensure Pillar to Life E-Learning.jpg

tags: Commercial Acumen, Financial Decision Making, Strategic Influence
name: Cash management E-Learning
description:
Audience: Sourcing Associates, Operations Associates

Description:
After successful completion of this 45-minute E-Learning, learners will understand why cash management is so important to us and what their role is in the implementation of cash and working capital initiatives.


By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Understand our Cash Management process and how it aligns with the Five Principles.
-Feel confident in applying this process in their roles.
-Know where to access resources for additional support.

tags: Category Management, Competitive Bids, Negotiation
name: Competitive Bidding Overview E-Learning
description:
Audience: Sourcing and Commercial Operations Associates.

Description:
Competitive bidding is an essential skill to learn to effectively support Mars Sourcing and Operations.  This E-Learning course equips participants with a comprehensive understanding of the competitive bidding process and how to appropriately engage in negotiations.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Describe the competitive bidding process comprehensively.
-Explore the benefits and advantages associated with competitive bidding.
-Explain the specific procedures and methods employed for competitive bidding within Mars Incorporated.
-Gain insight into further areas of professional development to effectively work this process.

tags: Category Management, Competitive Bids, Negotiation
name: Competitive Bidding Pallets example E-Learning
description:
Audience: Sourcing and Commercial Operations Associates.

Description:
This course helps to further your understanding of the Competitive Bidding process by exploring a real-life example.


By the end of this course, you will be able to:
Explain the practical application of the process steps.
Identify some key learnings and watch outs when conducting an e-auction

Prerequisites: Complete Competitive Bidding Overview E-Learning (Essential)

tags: Contract Management
name: Contract Law E-Learning
description:
Audience: Sourcing and Operations Associates

Description:
Contracts are necessary legal documents that manage the risks as well as promote the value of establishing and maintaining relationships with Mars suppliers.

Learning Objectives:
-Define in basic legal language what a contract is and why we need it.
-Describe the different types of contracts used when exchanging information, protecting Intellectual Property, and purchasing goods or services.
-Define the contract terms that define the transaction, facilitate the exchange and allocate risks.
-Locate and use the available templates and the Contract Playbook.
-Describe the recommended Ways of Working with Legal to prepare your agreements.

tags: Cost-Benefit Judgement, Financial Analysis and Reporting, Supplier Quality Management
name: Cost Calculation E-learning
description:
Audience: Associates looking for knowledge in detailed cost modeling and supplier-specific cost analysis.

Description:
This e-learning course provides a thorough breakdown of cost calculation, focusing on the development of a detailed cost model and a supplier-specific cost analysis.


By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Understand the components of a detailed cost model.
-Construct a supplier-specific cost model with a complete breakdown of costs.

tags: Cost-Benefit. Judgement, Data Analysis, Decision Making, Financial Analysis and Reporting, Negotiation
name: Cost Estimation E-learning
description:
Audience: Associates looking for foundational skills in cost estimation using industry standards.

Description:
This essential e-learning course guides learners through the creation of a basic industry cost model, utilizing industry averages as a foundation for cost negotiations.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Build a basic Industry Cost Model.
-Work effectively with industry averages.
-Establish a starting point for cost negotiations.

tags: Commercial Acumen, Commercial Operational Excellence, Strategic Alignment
name: Essence of Commercial E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Commercial Associates.

Description:
This e-learning course aims to provide new associates with an insightful overview of the Commercial Division, its significance within the business, and the essential contributions of Commercial associates.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Understand the historical background of the Commercial Division.
-Comprehend the role of Commercial associates in contributing to the business.
Familiarize themselves with the One Commercial operating model.
-Grasp the essence of Commercial @ Mars and its significance.
-Gain insight into the Five Commercial pillars and their critical levers.

tags: Business Compliance
name: Global Travel Policy 2.0 E-learning
description:
Audience: All Active T&E Cardholders or Associates who have submitted an expense report since 2018 (List will be provided).

Description:
This highly interactive E-Learning reviews all the key points of the Mars Global Travel Policy to ensure Associate safety, health and wellbeing.  It also helps deliver savings to Mars, which can be reinvested, and reduces our carbon footprint.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Under what situations to book travel for yourself and with colleagues
-How to involve managers in the decision-making process
-How soon to secure your travel arrangements using the Mars Travel Management Company and the best practices to follow to reduce costs while ensuring a safe journey
-What type of airline ticket, ground transportation and accommodation to secure
-When and how to undergo a health risk assessment, if necessary
What expenses are reimbursable and how to avoid assuming any extra personal expenses that are non-reimbursable
-The responsibilities associated with using a Mars corporate credit card

tags: Business Processes, Contract Management, Facility Management, Operational Excellence, Strategic Influence
name: Integrated Facility Management - Sodexo E-learning
description:
Audience: This course is designed for individuals involved in facilities management at Mars, specifically those who will act as the Single Point of Contact (SPOC) for managing Integrated Facility Management (IFM) related topics on a site.

Description:
This e-learning module offers a fundamental understanding of Integrated Facility Management (IFM) within Mars, focusing on the consolidation of facilities management services and processes. It covers the basics of IFM, including contractual agreements and operational methodologies, primarily through a series of onboarding videos and engaging quizzes for new Mars SPOCs.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Understand the concept of Integrated Facility Management (IFM) and its value to Mars.
-Describe the governance structure and significance of contractual agreements in IFM.
-Identify financial principles and operational methodologies under IFM.
-Navigate the role and responsibilities of a Mars SPOC in managing IFM topics.

tags: Actionable Insights, Strategic Alignment, Team Communication
name: Introduction to Commercial Foundations Video
description:
Audience: All Commercial Associates.

Description:
This brief video serves as an introduction to the Commercial Foundations program.


By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Understand the purpose and goals of the Commercial Foundations program.
-Comprehend the expectations for learners participating in this essential program.

tags: Functional Technical, Intellectual Property Law
name: Mars Legal Intellectual Property Patents & Technology Training E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Associates

Description:
By the end of this E-Learning Associates will have a foundational understanding of what Intellectual Property is, why it is important, and roles and responsibilities in safeguarding Intellectual Property.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Define Intellectual Property (IP) and its importance at Mars.
-Identify and cite examples of the different types of Intellectual Property managed by the Mars Legal IP—Patents & Technology Team.
-Recognize best practices to safeguard Mars’s Intellectual Property as well as the Intellectual Property rights of others.
-Realize the business consequences if IP is not protected.
-Describe the relationship between the Associate and the Mars Legal IP—Patents & Technology Team in protecting Mars’s IP.

tags: Quality Management Process
name: Mars Quality Strategy Methodology (MQSM) Foundations E-Learning
description:
Audience: Commercial Associates

Description:
This module provides a high-level overview of MQSM, the cross-segment process used by the Commercial team to maintain quality focus in material sourcing strategies.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

-Gain a comprehensive understanding of the MQSM process and its significance in maintaining quality focus in material sourcing strategies.
-Identify and comprehend the key stakeholders involved in the MQSM process and their respective roles.
-Learn the essential steps involved in developing and approving a quality strategy within the MQSM framework, ensuring alignment with quality goals and standards.
thumbFileUuid: Mars Quality Strategy Methodology (MQSM) Foundations E-Learning.png

tags: Sourcing Category Expertise, Sourcing Strategy Development and Implementation
name: MSSM Foundations E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Commercial Associates.

Description:
The Mars Strategic Sourcing Methodology (MSSM) is the key business process Commercial uses to develop, execute, and institutionalize sourcing strategies for different buying categories. Having close alignment and involvement from key stakeholders throughout the process is critical.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

-Understand the Mars Strategic Sourcing Methodology (MSSM) and its significance in sourcing strategies.
-Comprehend their role within the MSSM process and the importance of stakeholder involvement.
-Familiarize themselves with various Commercial tools and processes used in sourcing.

name: Next Generation Supplier E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Commercial Associates

Description:
Sustainability matters at Mars and is deeply rooted into our ambition to create a better world for future generations. The Next Generation Supplier Program helps us to deliver on our Sustainable in a Generation plan goals and drives our ambition to improve the working lives of 1 million people in our supply chain.

Learning Objectives:

-Explain how the Next Generation Program works, including its purpose and your role in its deployment.

-Define and explore the three elements of the program: Align, Asses and Advance.

-Develop your understanding of your responsibility for the success of the program.

-Discuss the program with other Commercial Associates and share your knowledge with our suppliers and other external parties.

tags: Packaging, Risk Assessments, Risk Management, Sourcing Quality Management: Packaging
name: Packaging Risk Assessment E-Learning

tags: Incident, Management, Risk Management, Safety at Mars, Supplier Quality Management
name: Программа: SQA Safety Part 1: Building a Culture of Safety E-Learning
description:
Audience: Commercial Associates in SQA,  External manufacturing Associates, as well as Associates traveling to and working at facilities external to MARS, including operators, engineers, and technicians.

Description:

Part 1: Elevate Your Safety Awareness at MARS

Join us on a transformative journey towards safety excellence at MARS. In this section, you'll assess your risk awareness and embrace our core principle: Safety is your top responsibility. Learn from our experiences and become a vital part of the MARS safety culture.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Gain the ability to assess their risk awareness in various situations.
-Understand the significance of being proactive in ensuring safety.
-Internalize the core principle that safety is your primary responsibility.
-Learn from past incidents and defining moments at MARS to appreciate the importance of preventing accidents.

tags: Incident, Management, Risk Management, Safety at Mars, Supplier Quality Management
name: Программа: SQA Safety Part 2 E-Learning
description:
Audience: Commercial Associates in SQA, External manufacturing Associates as well as Associates travelling to and working at facilities external to MARS being operators, engineers, technicians.

Description:

Part #2 focuses on preventing the most severe incidents

This section will provide you with the keys to prevent the most severe incidents using the Serious Injuries and Fatalities (SIF) prevention model and understanding what you can control.

tags: Incident, Management, Risk Management, Safety at Mars, Supplier Quality Management
name: Программа: SQA Safety Part 3 E-Learning
description:
Audience: Commercial Associates in SQA, External manufacturing Associates as well as Associates travelling to and working at facilities external to MARS being operators, engineers, technicians.

Description:

Part #3 makes of you an actor of your own safety and the safety of others.

This section will explore how to prepare for a visit, makes you aware of the importance of emotions and how they affect decisions. Finally, it will formalize the contract of safe habits to engage the first steps of making safety your first responsibility.

tags: Responsible Sourcing, Supplier Development
name: Supplier Code of Conduct E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Commercial Associates

Description:
The Supplier Code of Conduct is Mars´ business policy that informs our suppliers of our standards and expectations that we believe enable businesses to grow sustainably. This E-Learning is applicable for all Mars associates and is particularly relevant for Associates in Commercial who are directly involved in managing relationships with our suppliers.

Learning Objectives:

-Describe the purpose of the Mars Supplier Code of Conduct.
-Access and review the policy document.
-Understand the Social, Ethical and Environmental expectations under which we engage our first-tier suppliers.
-Outline the role Commercial Associates play in ensuring the policy is communicated to our suppliers.

tags:
Change Management, Commercial Acumen, Corporate Social Responsibility, CSR,
Diversity Awareness, Diversity Strategies, Strategic Communication Planning, Supplier Diversity
name: Supplier Diversity Awareness E-learning
description:
Audience: All Associates at Mars, particularly those in Commercial roles

Description:
This e-learning course serves as an introductory awareness program for all Commercial associates at Mars, focusing on the Supplier Diversity Program. It provides comprehensive insights into the history, importance, and operational aspects of supplier diversity, equipping associates to effectively advocate and contribute to the program's objectives.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Understand the history and overall significance of Supplier Diversity programs.
-Grasp the specifics, risks, rewards, and goals of the Mars Inc. Supplier Diversity program.
-Recognize the role of Commercial Sourcing Associates in relation to Supplier Diversity.
-Act as ambassadors or advocates for the Supplier Diversity program, fostering a positive shift in attitude.
-Identify and use key terminology and tools to promote the Supplier Diversity program.
-Explain the Supplier Diversity Program using an infographic.
-Successfully promote the Supplier Diversity program to at least five individuals within or outside Mars within 30 days of completing the course.

tags: Commercial Operational Excellence, Supplier Management
name: Supplier Relationship Management E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Commercial Associates.

Description:
This brief video serves as an introduction to the Commercial Foundations program.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Recognize the importance of Supplier Relationship Management (SRM) for Mars.
-Understand the internal challenges and obstacles to success in SRM.
-Comprehend the SRM@Mars process, including Supplier Segmentation, actions, and tools for managing suppliers at various levels.
-Apply best practices for effective supplier performance management.
-Gain insight into the Partnering for Success Program and its role within the SRM@Mars Process.

tags: Sourcing Category expertise
name: Программа: Animal Protein Material School Module 1: Industry Overview E-Learning
description:
Audience: SQA, Sourcing & Operation associates in Commercial focused on the Animal Protein category, and Raw Material Experts in R&D

Description:
"Having deep technical and industry knowledge about a certain material is critical in helping Mars manage the quality of its raw materials and the final products we sell to our consumers. Animal Protein and Tallow are some of our most critical groups of materials in the Petcare segment. The purpose of this learning series is to help build deeper knowledge and understanding of this category.
The program is designed to inform you about Animal Protein and Tallows as materials and inspire you to help protect quality at Mars.

This program consists of 11 interactive micro-elearning modules ranging from 10 to 30 mins in duration and content is presented in a number of interactive formats. The first two modules are core to all 3 materials in this category and then Wet and Dry Animal Protein, and Tallow have 3 modules each,with specific information relating to each of them as key raw materials for Mars. E1 While different modules are aimed at different roles, we do encourage you to complete all 11 modules in order to build your category expertise and become a quality ambassador for Mars.
As a result of this micro-learning series, associates will be able to:
- Have a good understanding of the Animal Protein and Tallow industry
- Identify the factors to manage critical risks to reduce the number of quality & food safety incidents, supplier non-conformances and consumer complaints.
- Know the steps to put supplier development and continuous improvement plans in place to manage and minimize risk in the relevant part of the supply chain
- Provide quality and material specific input to the Category Strategy
- Use best practices in auditing Animal Protein and Tallow suppliers and understand the Mars requirement and expectation of this category.

This is the first of eleven modules that are part of the Animal Protein Materials Schools and focuses on providing an overview of the Industry and its relevance to Mars' Petcare products.

The purpose of this learning series is to help build deeper knowledge and understanding of this category.
The program is designed to inform you about Animal Protein and Tallows as materials and inspire you to help protect quality at Mars.

This program consists of 11 interactive micro-elearning modules ranging from 10 to 30 mins in duration and content is presented in a number of interactive formats. The first two modules are core to all 3 materials in this category and then Wet and Dry Animal Protein, and Tallow have 3 modules each,with specific information relating to each of them as key raw materials for Mars. E1 While different modules are aimed at different roles, we do encourage you to complete all 11 modules in order to build your category expertise and become a quality ambassador for Mars.
As a result of this micro-learning series, associates will be able to:
- Have a good understanding of the Animal Protein and Tallow industry
- Identify the factors to manage critical risks to reduce the number of quality & food safety incidents, supplier non-conformances and consumer complaints.
- Know the steps to put supplier development and continuous improvement plans in place to manage and minimize risk in the relevant part of the supply chain
- Provide quality and material specific input to the Category Strategy
- Use best practices in auditing Animal Protein and Tallow suppliers and understand the Mars requirement and expectation of this category.

This module is part of the Animal Protein Materials Schools, and focuses specifically on Tallow and its production. In this module, you will learn how to assess risks introduced at various parts of the supply chain - those that are inherent in the materials, that arise during supplier processing, or during transport.

tags: Commercial Operational, Excellence, Quality Management Process, Strategic Alignment, Strategic Influence, Supplier Quality Management
name: Программа: Commercial Quality Culture Module 1: Quality E-Learning
description:
Audience: Commercial Associates

Description:
Where are you on the Quality culture journey?
As Commercial associates, we all share a collective responsibility for Quality. This course reminds us of that and what actions we can take to strengthen the application of this vital principle.
In this course, we hear from current associates about their role and the impact they have on Quality. We also learn about some incidents within Mars that have had a significant impact on our business and customers, what they were, and how they play a part in our drive for Quality.

In this module, we hear from current associates about their role and the impact they have on Quality. We also learn about some incidents within Mars that have had a significant impact on our business and customers, what they were, and how they play a part in our drive for Quality. As Commercial associates, we all share a collective responsibility for Quality. This course reminds us of that and what actions we can take to strengthen the application of this vital principle.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
- Understand the role of Commercial Associates in the Quality culture journey.
- Recognize incidents within Mars that impacted business and customers.
- Learn how to contribute to the drive for Quality within the organization.

name: Программа: Commercial Quality Culture Module 2: Five Quality Behaviours for Commercial E-Learning
description:
Audience: Commercial Associates

Description:
Where are you on the Quality culture journey?
As Commercial associates, we all share a collective responsibility for Quality. This course reminds us of that and what actions we can take to strengthen the application of this vital principle.
In this course, we hear from current associates about their role and the impact they have on Quality. We also learn about some incidents within Mars that have had a significant impact on our business and customers, what they were, and how they play a part in our drive for Quality.

In this module, we explore 5 key quality behaviors for Commercial and complete 5 real Mars Commercial scenarios on these behaviors. This is a chance for you to examine how well you know these required behaviors, demonstrate them in your role, and the ease with which you can apply them.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
- Understand and apply the 5 key quality behaviors for Commercial.
- Demonstrate these behaviors in their role effectively.

tags: Actionable Insights, Commercial Operational Excellence, Quality Culture, Team Collaboration, Supplier Quality Management
name: Программа: Commercial Quality Culture Module 3: Commercial Quality Health Check E-Learning
description:
Audience: Commercial Associates

Description:
Where are you on the Quality culture journey?
As Commercial associates, we all share a collective responsibility for Quality. This course reminds us of that and what actions we can take to strengthen the application of this vital principle.
In this course, we hear from current associates about their role and the impact they have on Quality. We also learn about some incidents within Mars that have had a significant impact on our business and customers, what they were, and how they play a part in our drive for Quality.

Ever been to the doctor and completed a personal health check? Well, in this module, you have the opportunity to complete a Commercial Quality health check assessment from your personal perspective. You will get the opportunity to examine where you believe you are against our Quality behavior ambitions, operations, and processes. To complete this module, you have a chance to provide a reflection on insights from your own Quality Culture health check and then use this in conjunction with those of your colleagues in your team.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
- Complete a Commercial Quality health check assessment.
- Reflect on personal insights regarding Quality behavior ambitions, operations, and processes.

description:

No matter whether you're regional, global, local, or just you, we all sit within one of the many job families within Commercial. This module provides all the tools to help line managers and their teams to distill individual Quality health check inputs into a Quality action plan for your team.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
- Utilize tools to distill individual Quality health check inputs into a Quality action plan for their team.
