name: Программа: Commercial Quality Culture Module 5: Reflections and Next Steps. What will I do now? E-Learning
description:
Audience: Commercial Associates

Description:
Where are you on the Quality culture journey?
As Commercial associates, we all share a collective responsibility for Quality. This course reminds us of that and what actions we can take to strengthen the application of this vital principle.
In this course, we hear from current associates about their role and the impact they have on Quality. We also learn about some incidents within Mars that have had a significant impact on our business and customers, what they were, and how they play a part in our drive for Quality.

Now that you have completed your Quality action plan, you need to take a moment to reflect on where you have landed. What are your next steps and what other resources are available to assist with your journey? Be inspired by our MCLT Leaders discussing Quality and Leadership and listen to their personal stories of what quality means to them.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
- Reflect on their Quality action plan.
- Identify their next steps in their Quality journey.
- Explore available resources for assistance.

tags: Commercial finance
name: Программа: Mars Currency Training - Module 1: Currency Risk Management E-Learning
description:
Audience: Sourcing associates

Description:
An introduction to Currency Risk Management at Mars. This series of interactive eLearning modules helps associates identify currency risks, understand their responsibilities, financial impact on the business and how the Currency Center can help manage these risks. The modules also give learners the knowledge and tools to effectively work with the Currency Center. After the program, associates will be able to identify, measure, communicate and manage currency risk. Understand the roles and responsibilities of different parties involved and know who to contact for assistance. The course should give associates the required confidence to ask the right questions of suppliers and better understand currency terminology within the organization.

Introduction to the currency risks Mars faces from operating in an international environment and how Mars manages these risks.  Topics include global currency market basics, hedging principles, hedging instruments used by Mars, and the global currency hedging process. The goal of this module is to provide a foundation in understanding currency risks principles and risk management techniques used by Mars.

tags: Commercial finance
name: Программа: Mars Currency Training - Module 2: Mars Currency Policy and Your Responsibility E-Learning
description:
Audience: Sourcing associates

Description:
An introduction to Currency Risk Management at Mars. This series of interactive eLearning modules helps associates identify currency risks, understand their responsibilities, financial impact on the business and how the Currency Center can help manage these risks. The modules also give learners the knowledge and tools to effectively work with the Currency Center. After the program, associates will be able to identify, measure, communicate and manage currency risk. Understand the roles and responsibilities of different parties involved and know who to contact for assistance. The course should give associates the required confidence to ask the right questions of suppliers and better understand currency terminology within the organization.

Introduction to Mars Currency Policy, why it is in place, and each group’s role in the process. This module defines the roles and responsibilities of key internal teams such as the Currency Center, Commercial, S&F, and the In Country Treasury Center (ICTC). The module also covers how to locate the Currency related policy’s in the Mars Finance Manual.

tags: Commercial finance
name: Программа: Mars Currency Training - Module 3: Exposure Identification and Forecasting Accuracy E-Learning
description:
Audience: Sourcing associates

Description:
An introduction to Currency Risk Management at Mars. This series of interactive eLearning modules helps associates identify currency risks, understand their responsibilities, financial impact on the business and how the Currency Center can help manage these risks. The modules also give learners the knowledge and tools to effectively work with the Currency Center. After the program, associates will be able to identify, measure, communicate and manage currency risk. Understand the roles and responsibilities of different parties involved and know who to contact for assistance. The course should give associates the required confidence to ask the right questions of suppliers and better understand currency terminology within the organization.

This module will explain the currency exposures Mars faces and how to identify and forecast them accurately. The topics include identifying and categorizing common currency exposures, challenges in forecasting exposures, the process of submitting exposure forecasts to the Currency Center, and the impact of inaccurate forecasts.

tags: Commercial finance
name: Программа: Mars Currency Training - Module 4: Financial Impact E-Learning
description:
Audience: Sourcing associates

Description:
An introduction to Currency Risk Management at Mars. This series of interactive eLearning modules helps associates identify currency risks, understand their responsibilities, financial impact on the business and how the Currency Center can help manage these risks. The modules also give learners the knowledge and tools to effectively work with the Currency Center. After the program, associates will be able to identify, measure, communicate and manage currency risk. Understand the roles and responsibilities of different parties involved and know who to contact for assistance. The course should give associates the required confidence to ask the right questions of suppliers and better understand currency terminology within the organization.

This module explains in detail how currency hedging protects the financial statements of Mars. Key topics include how hedging results are calculated and provided by the Currency Center, relationship and financial offsets between the currency exposure and the hedging instrument, how to record hedging results in the General Ledger, and Currency Center reports available to help explain any financial impacts.

tags: Commercial finance
name: Программа: Mars Currency Training - Module 5: Mars FX Rates Explained E-Learning
description:
Audience: Sourcing associates

Description:
An introduction to Currency Risk Management at Mars. This series of interactive eLearning modules helps associates identify currency risks, understand their responsibilities, financial impact on the business and how the Currency Center can help manage these risks. The modules also give learners the knowledge and tools to effectively work with the Currency Center. After the program, associates will be able to identify, measure, communicate and manage currency risk. Understand the roles and responsibilities of different parties involved and know who to contact for assistance. The course should give associates the required confidence to ask the right questions of suppliers and better understand currency terminology within the organization.

Overview of Foreign Exchange rates used for planning and accounting at Mars. The module covers Mars Billing Rates (MBR1 & MBR2), Mars Planning and Consolidation Rates (MPCR), and periodic accounting rates. The goal of the module is to provide a practical look at how the rates are calculated by the Currency Center, when they are available, and for what situation they should be used.

name: Программа: Dairy Material School Module 1: Industry Overview Video
description:
Audience: SQA, Sourcing & Operation associates in Commercial focused on the Dairy category, and Raw Material Experts in R&D.

Description:
Having deep technical and industry knowledge about a certain material is critical in helping Mars manage the quality of its raw materials and the final products we sell to our consumers. Dairy is one of our most critical materials in the Confectionery segment and the purpose of this program is to help you build deeper knowledge and understanding of this category. 
The program is designed to inform you about dairy as a group of materials and inspire you to help protect quality at Mars. 

This is the first of five modules that are part of the Dairy Material School and focuses on providing an overview of the Dairy Industry and its relevance to Mars' Confectionery products.
thumbFileUuid: Great Place to Work – Products – DSC 5102.jpg

name: Программа: Dairy Material School Module 2: Material Functionality E-Learning
description:
Audience: SQA, Sourcing and Operation associates in Commercial focused on the Dairy category, and Raw Material Experts in R&D

Description:
Having deep technical and industry knowledge about a certain material is critical in helping Mars manage the quality of its raw materials and the final products we sell to our consumers. Dairy is one of our most critical materials in the Confectionery segment and the purpose of this program is to help you build deeper knowledge and understanding of this category. 
The program is designed to inform you about dairy as a group of materials and inspire you to help protect quality at Mars. 

This is the second of five modules that are part of the Dairy Material School and provides a solid overview of how dairy is used in Mars products, the functionality of different types of dairy materials, and the quality considerations. 
This module is presented in the form of an interactive quiz that tests your existing knowledge and helps you build a more in-depth understanding.
thumbFileUuid: Great Place to Work – Products – DSC 5102.jpg

name: Программа: Dairy Material School Module 3: Supplier Dairy Processes E-Learning
description:
Audience: SQA, Sourcing and Operation associates in Commercial focused on the Dairy category, and Raw Material Experts in R&D

Description:
Having deep technical and industry knowledge about a certain material is critical in helping Mars manage the quality of its raw materials and the final products we sell to our consumers. Dairy is one of our most critical materials in the Confectionery segment and the purpose of this program is to help you build deeper knowledge and understanding of this category. 
The program is designed to inform you about dairy as a group of materials and inspire you to help protect quality at Mars. 

This is the third of five modules that are part of the Dairy Material School. In this module, we will examine life cycle of dairy, all the way from the collection, to the suppliers' processes all the way to the use in our products. We will also take a closer look at the production processes of Milk Powder, AMF and Whey. Your understanding of these will help you to put appropriate controls to manage risks and quality.
thumbFileUuid: Great Place to Work – Products – DSC 5102.jpg

name: Программа: Dairy Material School Module 4: MRA and Audit Best Practices E-Learning
description:
Audience: SQA, Sourcing and Operation associates in Commercial focused on the Dairy category, and Raw Material Experts in R&D

Description:
Having deep technical and industry knowledge about a certain material is critical in helping Mars manage the quality of its raw materials and the final products we sell to our consumers. Dairy is one of our most critical materials in the Confectionery segment and the purpose of this program is to help you build deeper knowledge and understanding of this category. 
The program is designed to inform you about dairy as a group of materials and inspire you to help protect quality at Mars. 

This is the fourth of five modules that are part of the Dairy Material School. In this module, you will learn about the rigorous processes that Mars has in place to prevent quality issues, how to detect quality issues if they do arise and you will become well versed in Material Risk Assessment and audit best practices for dairy materials.
thumbFileUuid: Great Place to Work – Products – DSC 5102.jpg

name: Программа: Dairy Material School Module 5: Verification Program E-Learning
description:
Audience: SQA, Sourcing and Operation associates in Commercial focused on the Dairy category, and Raw Material Experts in R&D

Description:
Having deep technical and industry knowledge about a certain material is critical in helping Mars manage the quality of its raw materials and the final products we sell to our consumers. Dairy is one of our most critical materials in the Confectionery segment and the purpose of this program is to help you build deeper knowledge and understanding of this category. 
The program is designed to inform you about dairy as a group of materials and inspire you to help protect quality at Mars. 

This is the fifth and final module of the Dairy Material School. In this module, we will follow a supplier and see if he is following the verification requirements, controls and best practices. Additionally, you will understand our layers of defense and know how to apply them in the field.

name: Программа: Flexible Packaging Material School Module 1: Industry Overview E-learning
description:
Audience: Commercial:  SQA, Strategic Sourcing & Buying Operations R&D: Packaging Material , Quality & Food Safety, External MNew Product Development (NPD), Product & Process Translation &Support (PPTS)

Description:
WHY IS THIS IMPORTANT?
Flexible materials are the best of choice to present and preserve food brands and consumer packaged goods. They have a critical role to deliver the sight, sound, touch and smell necessary to enhance customer experience and are uniquely suited to provide additional benefits to our customers including reclosure and dispensing options, extend the shelf life, convenience, and product protection. 
The purpose of this, first of its kind, packaging material school is to help participants to build a deeper knowledge and understanding of the flexible category, material composition, functionality and requirements to protect the quality of Mars products.  

HOW DOES THIS TRAINING HELP ME?
After completing this course, you should be able to:
- Describe the  purpose and functionality of the flexible materials
- Understand the different types of base polymer films and adhesives
- Explain the flexible material manufacturing process 
- Understand types and purpose of the different printing and finishing processes 
- Describe different Mars flexible material usages
- Identify common material risk and learn mitigation practices

name: Программа: Flexible Packaging Material School Module 2C: Types of Flexible Packaging E-learning
description:
Audience: Commercial:  SQA, Strategic Sourcing & Buying Operations R&D: Packaging Material , Quality & Food Safety, External MNew Product Development (NPD), Product & Process Translation &Support (PPTS)

Description:
WHY IS THIS IMPORTANT?
Flexible materials are the best of choice to present and preserve food brands and consumer packaged goods. They have a critical role to deliver the sight, sound, touch and smell necessary to enhance customer experience and are uniquely suited to provide additional benefits to our customers including reclosure and dispensing options, extend the shelf life, convenience, and product protection. 
The purpose of this, first of its kind, packaging material school is to help participants to build a deeper knowledge and understanding of the flexible category, material composition, functionality and requirements to protect the quality of Mars products.  

HOW DOES THIS TRAINING HELP ME?
After completing this course, you should be able to:
- Describe the  purpose and functionality of the flexible materials
- Understand the different types of base polymer films and adhesives
- Explain the flexible material manufacturing process 
- Understand types and purpose of the different printing and finishing processes 
- Describe different Mars flexible material usages
- Identify common material risk and learn mitigation practices
thumbFileUuid: Great Place to Work – Factory – Birstall Factory11

name: Программа: Herbs and Spices Material School: Module 1 - Industry Overview E-learning
description:
Audience: Commercial Associates in SQA, Sourcing & Operations, as well as R&D Raw Materials and Q&FS Experts, working with Herbs and Spices

Description:
PURPOSE:
Ah… the fragrant smell of vanilla bean, rosemary or thyme … is there anything more pleasing? The wonderful flavours they add, more than enough to create depth, excitement and “wicked” flavours for authentic meal occasions. For Herbs and Spices to realize this every day for any meal occasion, globally requires us to have a deep technical and industry knowledge of herbs and spices. Allowing us to help Mars manage the quality of its raws and the final products for Masterfoods Food and our consumers. Never before has some much technical & quality understanding been made available in an instant for a most critical Mars Food category.
This learning series will help build deeper knowledge and understanding of this category.
The program is designed to inform you about Herbs and Spices as materials, the risks in the supply chain and to inspire you to help protect quality at Mars.

OVERVIEW:
This program consists of 8 interactive micro e-learning modules ranging from 10 to 40 mins in duration and content is presented in a number of interactive formats.
While different modules are aimed at different roles, we do encourage you to complete all of the modules in order to build your category expertise and become a quality ambassador for Mars.
As a result of this micro-learning series, associates will be able to:
- Have a good understanding of the Herbs and Spices industry
- Identify the factors to manage critical risks to reduce the number of quality & food safety incidents, supplier non-conformances and consumer complaints.
- Know the steps to put supplier development and continuous improvement plans in place to manage and minimize risk in the relevant part of the supply chain
- Provide quality and material specific input to the Category Strategy
- Use best practices in auditing Herbs and Spices suppliers and understand the Mars requirement and expectation of this category.


This is the first of eight modules that will provide you with all of the SQA knowledge for category expertise on Herbs & Spices. Mars associates will embark on a journey through the Herbs and Spices trade History. They will learn the current situation of the Market, its trends and growth drivers where Mars has a clear role to play . The module also explains the classification and identification of the different Herbs and Spices.

This module provides the learner with expert R&D knowledge on the category. The associate will learn about the most important characteristics of these materials such as color, flavour and pungency. The module also touches on additional properties of the Herbs and Spices such as their antioxidant, antimicrobial and nutritional characteristics that contribute to the positive perception of these products. In addition this module also explores the main applications of these materials in the Industry.

Finally the learner will be trained on how to conduct an appropriate Herbs and Spices Risk Assessment.

tags: Supplier Quality Management
name: Программа: MQM Microbiology Essentials Module 1: Micro awareness for SQA E-Learning
description:
Audience: SQA Associates

Description:
Ever wondered about the world of spores, vegetative cells and pathogens and the impact micro-organisms can have on Mars products? Having an essential understanding of microbiological risks in the supply chain including knowledge on how to reduce and control microbiological risk is critical for Quality at Mars. Microbiology impacts the majority of the raw materials Mars procures. The purpose of this e-Learning is to provide advanced knowledge and real insights into the risks posed by micro-organisms.

This master program is designed to equip you with tools and intensive skills strengthening your capability on microbiology. While this course focusses on raw materials and essential elements of supplier control programs, it is also relevant for R&D and Q&FS roles working with raw materials.

This module will introduce the course and help learners to understand why the microbiological safety of raw materials procured by Mars is an essential part of the Material Quality Management (MQM). The module will explain the importance of having an essential understanding of the microbiological aspects of Mars raw materials and related suppliers control programs to effectively mitigate the microbiological risks in the food chain. By completing this module, learners will be able to understand and articulate the criticality of microbiological safety assessments within the MQM program to achieve raw material food safety, quality and legal compliance.

tags: Supplier Quality Management
name: Программа: MQM Microbiology Essentials Module 2: Microorganisms and Food Industry Concerns E-Learning
description:
Audience: SQA Associates

Description:
Ever wondered about the world of spores, vegetative cells and pathogens and the impact micro-organisms can have on Mars products? Having an essential understanding of microbiological risks in the supply chain including knowledge on how to reduce and control microbiological risk is critical for Quality at Mars. Microbiology impacts the majority of the raw materials Mars procures. The purpose of this e-Learning is to provide advanced knowledge and real insights into the risks posed by micro-organisms.

This master program is designed to equip you with tools and intensive skills strengthening your capability on microbiology. While this course focusses on raw materials and essential elements of supplier control programs, it is also relevant for R&D and Q&FS roles working with raw materials.

This module provides insight in the different types of microorganisms and how these can affect food. The module also describes how bacteria such as Salmonella, Listeria monocytogenes, and Bacillus cereus may cause food contamination and what impact this can have on consumers and food manufacturing sites. The learners will be able to differentiate between good, bad and ugly microorganisms and will gain understanding of transient and resident microorganisms in a food factory. The leaners will be able to specify the main pathogen(s) of concern for critical raw materials that are used in pet food production, chocolate making or dry rice processing at Mars.

tags: Supplier Quality Management
name: Программа: MQM Microbiology Essentials Module 3: Preventive Controls - Keep Them Out E-Learning (Essential)
description:
Audience: SQA Associates

Description:
Ever wondered about the world of spores, vegetative cells and pathogens and the impact micro-organisms can have on Mars products? Having an essential understanding of microbiological risks in the supply chain including knowledge on how to reduce and control microbiological risk is critical for Quality at Mars. Microbiology impacts the majority of the raw materials Mars procures. The purpose of this e-Learning is to provide advanced knowledge and real insights into the risks posed by micro-organisms.

This master program is designed to equip you with tools and intensive skills strengthening your capability on microbiology. While this course focusses on raw materials and essential elements of supplier control programs, it is also relevant for R&D and Q&FS roles working with raw materials.

This module explains the steps that occur prior to a pathogen contamination in a food plant. It helps learners to understand how preventive controls can avoid product contamination at an early stage. In this module, the essential pillars (three K's) of an effective micro control programs are explained. This module focuses in depth on the first preventive "K" within a pathogen control program: the "Keep them from staying" controls. Learners will be able to identify and assess microbiological risks related to the transport of raw materials supplied to Mars, risks related to improper segregation of raw materials from processed goods, risks related to employees introducing contamination, and risks related to inadequate factory flow. Learners will be able to assess the adequacy of water, air, dust and pest control programs to prevent contamination from the factory environment.

tags: Supplier Quality Management
name: Программа: MQM Microbiology Essentials Module 4: Preventive Controls - Kill Them E-Learning
description:
Audience: SQA Associates

Description:
Ever wondered about the world of spores, vegetative cells and pathogens and the impact micro-organisms can have on Mars products? Having an essential understanding of microbiological risks in the supply chain including knowledge on how to reduce and control microbiological risk is critical for Quality at Mars. Microbiology impacts the majority of the raw materials Mars procures. The purpose of this e-Learning is to provide advanced knowledge and real insights into the risks posed by micro-organisms.

This master program is designed to equip you with tools and intensive skills strengthening your capability on microbiology. While this course focusses on raw materials and essential elements of supplier control programs, it is also relevant for R&D and Q&FS roles working with raw materials.

In this module, the second "K" pillar of an effective pathogen control program is explained: the preventive control "Kill them". The module describes common kill steps (CCPs) used in the food and feed industry: sterilization, pasteurization, rendering cooking and irradiation, followed by an in depth explanation of acceptable validation approaches for microbiological CCPs. The learners will be able to understand the importance of a validated CCP in the supplier process, and to describe the difference in validation and monitoring of CCPs. Learners will be able to assess completeness of supplier validation activities, and to pinpoint weaknesses in the validation of supplier CCPs, as well as weaknesses in monitoring of critical and action limits for supplier CCPs.

tags: Supplier Quality Management
name: Программа: MQM Microbiology Essentials Module 5: Preventive Controls - Keep Them from Staying E-Learning
description:
Audience: SQA Associates

Description:
Ever wondered about the world of spores, vegetative cells and pathogens and the impact micro-organisms can have on Mars products? Having an essential understanding of microbiological risks in the supply chain including knowledge on how to reduce and control microbiological risk is critical for Quality at Mars. Microbiology impacts the majority of the raw materials Mars procures. The purpose of this e-Learning is to provide advanced knowledge and real insights into the risks posed by micro-organisms.

This master program is designed to equip you with tools and intensive skills strengthening your capability on microbiology. While this course focusses on raw materials and essential elements of supplier control programs, it is also relevant for R&D and Q&FS roles working with raw materials.

In this module, the third and last "K" pillar of an effective pathogen control program is explained: the preventive control "Keep them from staying". The module provides insights on how factory zoning and hygienic design, in conjunction with effective cleaning and prevention of water ingress can help in minimizing pathogen persistence in the factory environment. Learners will be able to assess weaknesses in a factory lay-out, in equipment design and its cleaning programs. Learners will gain understanding on the criticality of condensation issues and water ingress in dry production facilities. Learners will be able to assess whether all essential elements are present and in control when assessing the preventive controls of the supplier.

tags: Supplier Quality Management
name: Программа: MQM Microbiology Essentials Module 6: Verification and Validation E-Learning
description:
Audience: SQA Associates

Description:
Ever wondered about the world of spores, vegetative cells and pathogens and the impact micro-organisms can have on Mars products? Having an essential understanding of microbiological risks in the supply chain including knowledge on how to reduce and control microbiological risk is critical for Quality at Mars. Microbiology impacts the majority of the raw materials Mars procures. The purpose of this e-Learning is to provide advanced knowledge and real insights into the risks posed by micro-organisms.

This master program is designed to equip you with tools and intensive skills strengthening your capability on microbiology. While this course focusses on raw materials and essential elements of supplier control programs, it is also relevant for R&D and Q&FS roles working with raw materials.

This module explains the difference between verification and validation by providing cases relevant to SQA activities. The module will enhance understanding of why and how various microbiological monitoring programs must be implemented. The module focusses on principles to effectively monitor and trend risks in the factory environment, along the production process and in the finished product. The module also explains the basic elements of a reliable finished product test program and touches on common failures when setting up product testing as verification. Learners will be able to understand the value of pathogen versus indicator testing. They wil be able to assess the adequacy of supplier's micro test programs and they will gain a basic understanding on how to evaluate supplier lab competence.

tags: Supplier Quality Management
name: Программа: MQM Microbiology Essentials Module 7: What Would You Do? and Escalated Approach E-Learning
description:
Audience: SQA Associates

Description:
Ever wondered about the world of spores, vegetative cells and pathogens and the impact micro-organisms can have on Mars products? Having an essential understanding of microbiological risks in the supply chain including knowledge on how to reduce and control microbiological risk is critical for Quality at Mars. Microbiology impacts the majority of the raw materials Mars procures. The purpose of this e-Learning is to provide advanced knowledge and real insights into the risks posed by micro-organisms.

This master program is designed to equip you with tools and intensive skills strengthening your capability on microbiology. While this course focusses on raw materials and essential elements of supplier control programs, it is also relevant for R&D and Q&FS roles working with raw materials.

This module will show SQA Associates how to identify and respond to adverse events that may compromise the microbiological safety of raw materials. Learners will be able to gain hands-on experience by applying the competence and skills gained in the previous modules in a series of interactive cases. These interactive cases are designed to simulate situations that SQA Associates may encounter when qualifying or auditing suppliers. The cases also include scenarios where SQA is informed of product that is out of specification or produced under deviations from supplier's control programs. Learners will be able to advise on precautionary measures and escalated verification measures for suppliers in order to deal with adversity and reduce risk conditions to controlled operations

SQA Associates are required to pass this assessment module as part of the SQA license to operate.

tags: Food Safety and Sanitation, Nutrition, Pet Food
name: Программа: Palatants Material School Module 0: Ultra-High Business Impact (UHBI)​ E-learning
description:
Audience: Commercial:  SQA, Strategic Sourcing & Buying Operations
R&D: Raw Material Experts & Scientists, Quality & Food Safety
New Product Development (NPD), Product & Process Translation & Support (PPTS).

Description:
What if Mars only produced pet food without great smell and taste? Pets would only partially eat their food, and as a consequence, they would not receive the precise nutrition that they need. Furthermore, owners may easily switch to another brand if they see that their pet does not enjoy their food.
Have you ever wondered what animal proteins, enzymatic reactions, and spray dryers can create? Well, you’ve come to the right place!
The purpose of this learning series is to help build deeper knowledge and understanding of the palatant category. This learning series is also designed to inform you about the supply chain and manufacturing risks associated with the palatant category—information which will help you raise the bar as a product quality custodian at Mars.

After completing this course, you should be able to:
-Have a robust understanding of the Palatant industry
-Identify the factors to manage critical risks to reduce the number of quality and food safety incidents, supplier non-conformances, and consumer complaints.
-Know the steps to put supplier development and continuous improvement plans in place to manage and minimize risk in the relevant part of the supply chain
-Provide quality and material specific input to the Category Strategy
-Use best practices in auditing Palatant suppliers and understand Mars requirements and expectations of this category.

name: Программа: Rice Material School Module 1: Industry Overview Video
description:
Audience: SQA, Sourcing & Operation associates in Commercial focused on the Rice category, and Raw Material Experts in R&D.

Description:
Having deep technical and industry knowledge about a certain material is critical in helping Mars manage the quality of its raw materials and the final products we sell to our consumers. Rice is one of our most critical materials in the Food segment but also a key raw material for our Petcare Business. The purpose of this learning series is to help build deeper knowledge and understanding of this category.
The program is designed to inform you about Rice as a material and inspire you to help protect quality at Mars.

This program consists of 5 interactive micro-elearning modules ranging from 5 to 30 mins in duration and content is presented in a number of interactive formats. While different modules are aimed at different roles, we do encourage you to complete all 5 modules in order to build your category expertise and become a quality ambassador for Mars. 

As a result of this micro-learning series, associates will be able to:
- Have a good understanding of the rice industry
- Identify the factors to manage critical risks to reduce the number of quality & food safety incidents, supplier non-conformances and consumer complaints.
- Know the steps to put supplier development and continuous improvement plans in place to manage and minimize risk in the relevant part of the supply chain 
- Provide quality and material specific input to the Category Strategy
- Use best practices in auditing dairy suppliers and understand the Mars requirement and expectation of this category.

This is the first of five modules that are part of the Rice Material School and focuses on providing an overview of the Rice Industry and its relevance to Mars' Food & Petcare products.

This is the second of five modules that are part of the Rice Material School and provides a solid overview of the functionality, quality considerations and different types of rice Mars uses in its products - for both Food and Petcare brands.

This is the third of five modules that are part of the Rice Material School. In this module, we dive deeper into the processes that both Mars and our suppliers follow to produce various Rice products. We will also examine how we ensure Quality at different stages of production. 

This module is presented in an interactive and exploratory format that enables you to skip sections you are already familiar with or go deeper on certain topics that are of interest to you.

This is the fifth and final module of the Rice Material School. In this module, we will follow a supplier and see if he is following the verification requirements, controls and best practices. Additionally, you will learn how to mitigate the various risks that exist throughout the supply chain by comparing them to standard practices. You will also learn how to ensure quality compliance. 

This module is presented in the form of an interactive case study where we compare a supplier following the best practices and a supplier who isn't.

name: Программа: Tree Nuts Material School Module 1: Industry Overview E-Learning
description:
Audience: QA, Strategic Sourcing & Buying Operations
R&D: Raw Material Experts & Science, Quality & Food Safety
New Product Development (NPD), Product&Process Translation &Support (PPTS)

Description:
For Mars Wrigley having deep technical skills and industry knowledge of the Tree Nuts Category is critical to delivering more smiles for our consumers in the World of tomorrow. Tree Nuts are one of our most critical groups of materials in the Confectionery segment, part of iconic brands such as Snickers, M&M’s, Galaxy and Dove.
The purpose of this learning series is to help build deeper knowledge and understanding of this category.

The program is designed to inform you about Tree Nuts as materials and inspire you to help protect quality at Mars.

Module 1 of this Material School provides the learner with a good understanding on the Industry overview in the Tree Nuts category
The Module gives a broad overview on the growing and sourcing regions of various Tree Nuts and why it is an attractive commodity. The learner will discover more about the main Tree Nuts utilised at Mars: Almonds and Hazelnuts, as well as the key market drivers for these specific nuts.

name: Программа: Tree Nuts Material School Module 2: Material Functionality E-Learning
description:
Audience: QA, Strategic Sourcing & Buying Operations
R&D: Raw Material Experts & Science, Quality & Food Safety
New Product Development (NPD), Product&Process Translation &Support (PPTS)

Description:

The purpose of this learning series is to help build deeper knowledge and understanding of this category.

The program is designed to inform you about Tree Nuts as materials and inspire you to help protect quality at Mars.

Module 2 in the Tree Nut material school covers life cycle, key quality aspects and sustainability. The module will take the learners through the influence of such variables as soil and climatic condition on the tree nut life cycle.
This module will also take the learner though different varities forms of nut and their application and usage in Mars.

name: Программа: Tree Nuts Material School Module 3: Supplier and Mars Processes E-Learning
description:
Audience: QA, Strategic Sourcing & Buying Operations
R&D: Raw Material Experts & Science, Quality & Food Safety
New Product Development (NPD), Product&Process Translation &Support (PPTS)

Description:

The purpose of this learning series is to help build deeper knowledge and understanding of this category.

The program is designed to inform you about Tree Nuts as materials and inspire you to help protect quality at Mars.

This module covers all the major processes that occur post-harvesting. It takes the learners from drying and cracking of the nuts, through the supplier processes for nuts and paste and then into the Mars processes that use these materials.
The module covers the key process steps of both the supplier and Mars, and will demonstrate to the learner the MQM principles for these materials.

The program is designed to inform you about Tree Nuts as materials and inspire you to help protect quality at Mars.

Module 4 covers the risks associated with tree nuts and the use of Best Practice Supplier Audits to mitigate the risks in the supply chain.
This module gives the learner an in-depth understanding of this high risk material, and takes them through the SQA audit guidance and approach to assess each process all the way from the farm, through the supplier processes to the loading and transport of the processed nuts.
Learners can also leverage the benefit to download the Job Aid that they can apply during SQA Audits and to practice MQM

name: Программа: Tree Nuts Material School Module 5: Assessment E-Learning
description:
Audience: QA, Strategic Sourcing & Buying Operations
R&D: Raw Material Experts & Science, Quality & Food Safety
New Product Development (NPD), Product&Process Translation &Support (PPTS)

Description:
For Mars Wrigley having deep technical skills and industry knowledge of the Tree Nuts Category is critical to delivering more smiles for our consumers in the World of tomorrow. Tree Nuts are one of our most critical groups of materials in the Confectionery segment, part of iconic brands such as Snickers, M&M’s, Galaxy and Dove.
The purpose of this learning series is to help build deeper knowledge and understanding of this category.

The program is designed to inform you about Tree Nuts as materials and inspire you to help protect quality at Mars.

This is the final module of the Tree Nut Material School, and gives the learner the opportunity to verify their learnings from the previous 4 modules.
The assessment covers content from all the modules in this course and has a total of 22 questions for the learner to complete.

name: HACCP-based Food Safety Management Programme Foundations E-Learning
description:
Audience: This course is applicable globally to all associates and Mars Incorporated segments, business units and sites and specifically to all Supply, R&D and Commercial associates.

Description:
This training material supports the implementation of a Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP)-based Food Safety Management Programme, based on V2 of the Mars Incorporated Q&FS standard. It takes the format of a singular module developed specifically to introduce food safety management to Mars associates at any level within the organization.

By the end of this course, you will have:
-Explored HACCP & Food Safety Management within Mars;
-Examined the importance of Food Safety and how it impacts our business; and
-Identified the three main types of hazards and explore how these are controlled by:
-Prerequisite programmes (PRPs);
-Operational prerequisite programmes (OPRPs); and
-Critical control points.

name: Holistic Project Portfolio Management (HPPM) E-Learning
description:
Audience: All associates involved in Project Portfolio Management (governance and execution) across all functions.
Especially relevant for associates in Marketing, R&D, Supply, Commercial, S&F, and S&OP.

Description:
This training explains the approach and business value of Strategic Project Portfolio Management, provides an overview of Mars Inc.'s ecosystem of stage & gate process models on the PPM system, and explains fundamentals of the stage & gate approach.

The modular HPPM training design provides customized training by role. All associates involved in project portfolio governance or project execution should take this HPPM training. Associates involved in management of specific project portfolios should take specific process model trainings afterwards, on demand (QuEST, TRL, FEF, QES).

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Describe the purpose and benefits of HPPM.
-Outline the five key steps involved in realizing HPPM.
-Identify four fit-for-purpose models and how they enable Mars to both innovate and realize projects.
-Describe the purpose of the stage and gate process and how critical success factors inform the progression through it

The aim of this course is to give you a better understanding of Holistic Quality Risk Management, including What HQRM is, why it is important and an overview of the HQRM process.

Each of the objectives is covered in its own section. Once you have completed each section there will be a short quiz to check your understanding.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Explain what Holistic Quality Risk Management is;
-Why it is important; and
-Describe an overview of the HQRM process.

Description:
In this training you will learn about the science of looking at data and how statistics are used to support data analytics and population inferences. You will learn how to describe different types of data graphically and numerically. By the end of the course, you will be able to interpret descriptive statistics and will be able to incorporate the learnings into daily work.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Describe the use and benefit of statistics on samples of data;
-Numerically summarize data; and
-Explain how graphs can be used to describe data distributions.

Building on Module 1 of the Introduction to Statistics, this course is designed to take you beyond descriptive statistics by introducing the basic concepts of inductive statistics.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
Describe the importance of probability, significance, confidence, power and hypothesis tests in statistical analyses to optimize your forecasts using this scientific method.

The course is a prerequisite to all virtual and in-person essential level KQA trainings.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
- Understand the concept of KQAs and how they are central to the philosophy of consumer driven design;
-Appropriately prioritize information coming from consumers, and revisit the concept of laddering; 
-Understand how new processes can be optimally designed and controlled with KQA’s as an input; and
-Understand some of the challenges other departments face when dealing with KQA’s.

-Describe how compliance to the standard requirements delivers the required quality and service from our laboratories and how laboratory audits drive compliance, following a risk-based approach; and
-Explain how the laboratory metrics monitor and drive continuous improvement of quality and service.

This course introduces Good Manufacturing Practice and the global Mars GMP-GHP Standard as the foundation for safe food production. The program is intended for any Associate or contractor and will be universal across all Business Units and countries.

By the end of this course, you will:
- Understand the importance of Good Manufacturing Practice and know why it is important to identify and manage food hygiene risks;
- know that there is a Mars Global Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP-GHP) Standard that sets minimum requirements for Mars processes, people and environment; and

name: Material Risk Assessment (MRA) E-learning
description:
Audience: R&D and Commercial associates involved in Material Quality Management, Material Risk Assessments or any other quality related role.

Description:
Material Risk Assessments (MRAs) are an essential component of Mars' Material Quality Management (MQM) standard.

MRAs allow Mars to understand what food safety and quality hazards are associated with our raw materials and how we can mitigate these hazards to ensure safe and high-quality materials are used in our supply chain.

This MRA training course will allow associates to understand how to complete an MRA and the level of detail required to do so. In particular, the course focuses on understanding the intent and principles behind MRAs, defining food safety hazards and their sources, understanding the Likelihood of Occurrence (LoO) judgement, supplier and Mars controls of hazards and best practice MRAs.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Explain how to complete an MRA;
-Describe a range of different food safety hazards and their sources; and
-Describe what controls Mars can establish to reduce the risks.

name: Material Risk Assessment (MRA) Overview E-Learning
description:
Audience: R&D and Commercial associates involved in Material Quality Management, Material Risk Assessments or any other quality related role.

Description:
Material Risk Assessments (MRAs) are an essential component of Mars' Material Quality Management (MQM) standard.

MRAs allow Mars to understand what food safety and quality hazards are associated with our raw materials and how we can mitigate these hazards to ensure safe and high-quality materials are used in our supply chain.

This E-Learning provides a foundation level understanding of Material Risk Assessment (MRA) at Mars and will highlight the roles, responsibilities and actions involved in the MRA process along with the business benefits.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Understand the MRA process and how this drives Material Quality Management (MQM);
-Understand the business benefits of MRAs; and
-Have a basic understanding of how an MRA is completed.

Audience

R&D associates involved in Material Quality Management and in particular Material Risk Assessment technologists.

Description

This course describes the different biological hazards in Mars production sites, such as spore and toxin forming pathogens, viruses, parasites, and vegetative pathogens. It further introduces mitigation examples and references for further information for each of the different hazard types.

Learning Objectives

By the end of this course, you will have understood:

The different biological hazard categories and what makes them unique;

The different control measures available for these hazards; and

How to mitigate these hazards with suppliers.

name: Nutrition and What It Means To Us E-Learning
description:
Audience: Anyone interested in human nutrition. Module 3 is specifically important to Corporate Affairs, Marketing and Sales.

Description:
This training introduces basic concepts of nutrition, surrounding trends and the regulatory environment in an on-demand format of around 90 minutes, broken down into 3 modules:

1.      Global Societal Health (15 minutes)

2.      Basic Nutrition (45 minutes)

3.      External Environment (30 minutes)

Learning Objectives:
-Gain a basic understanding of nutrition, including what is needed for a healthy balanced diet 
- Learn about the external environment, how nutrition impacts public health, changing dietary patterns and how authorities are responding to the public health crisis.

name: Off-Pack Claims E-Learning
description:
Audience: R&D Innovation, SRA, Marketing, Corporate Affairs and Legal.

Description:
In this training you will learn the basics of making claims about Mars products and brands. More specifically, we are focusing on claims made anywhere other than directly on our product labels and packaging.

For simplicity, we will refer to these as “off-pack claims”.

Learning Objectives:
-By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Explain the reason for Mars’ use of off-pack claims;
-Describe their risks and requirements; and
-When to make them on your own the right way or when to escalate them to SRA or Legal for guidance.

tags:
Advertising Law,
Internal Controls,
Marketing Law,
Regulatory Compliance
name: On-Pack Claims Approval E-Learning
description:
Audience: SRA, Marketing and Legal associates as well as all associates involved in packaging design and claim developments.

Description:
This web-based learning will help users to understand why we make claims on our packs, the different types of claim that are made and the level of evidence required to substantiate them.

It describes the different levels of risk that may be associated with a claim, and different types of risk: regulatory, legal and business.

It also considers the requirement for sign-off of claims and/or risk at the appropriate business level, including the need for an escalation procedure for complex, sensitive or high-risk claims.

The training provides cross-segment examples at each stage, and finishes with a quiz for learners to test their knowledge and understanding.

Learning Objectives:
-By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Explain the reason for Mars’ use of on-pack claims;
-Describe its risks and requirements; and
-Understand how the Regulatory Compliance Standard for On-Pack Claims Approvals is relevant for your job.

-Understand the steps within PRIMP.
-Know how to identify a potential incident.

-Be able to escalate and effectively communicate a potential incident.

Description:
In this training you will learn about the QES stage and gate process. The QES process is a standardized framework to manage projects to ensure high-Quality products, drive Efficiency, and deliver on our Sustainability commitments, whilst ensuring that we remain competitive in line with our strategy.

Learning Objectives:

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Describe where the QES Process fits in the Project Innovation Lifecycle;
-Name the QES core principles that underpin the process; and
-Describe what occurs in each of the stages and gates that comprise the QES process.

name: QuEST Process E-Learning
description:
Audience: All associates involved in Project Portfolio Management (governance and execution) across all functions (Marketing, R&D, Supply, Commercial, S&F, S&OP).

Description:
In this training you will learn about the QuEST stage and gate process. QuEST is a cross-functional process which provides a standardized way to manage all product launches and changes to products which are perceivable to the consumer or customer.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Describe where the QuEST Process fits in the Project Innovation Lifecycle and how it benefits the business, consumer and customer by continually reinforcing Desirability Visibility Feasibility (DVF) factors.
-Name the 8 QuEST core principles that underpin the process.

Describe the importance that Critical Success Factors (CSFs) play in determining and advancing a project through the QuEST Process.

Review the "Spoke" concept and name the different subject matter experts that are involved in carrying out the QuEST Process for each "Spoke".

Describe what occurs in each of the stages and gates that comprise the QuEST process.

-Leverage the regulated materials process early
-Describe the possible composition of MARS WRIGLEY flavors
-Define a trade secret
-Apply the R&D Regulated Materials Process to your projects
-Recognize the value of the Monthly Flavor Safety Feeder Meeting

Understand what Listeria & Salmonella are. Be able to explain why we are concerned about these bacteria & Understand how we manage Salmonella & Listeria.

Learning Objectives
-By the end of this course, you will understand:
-What Salmonella and Listeria are;
-Why Salmonella and Listeria are important; and
-How associates and processes at Mars manage the risk associated with Salmonella and Listeria.

name: Recall Process Framework E-Learning
description:
Audience: Recall Coordinators, Market Quality Representatives and any associates involved in Recalls, usually with a background in Quality & Food Safety or Business Continuity Management.

Description:
The Recall Process Framework is a Mars Inc. global process designed to ensure that recalls are managed in a professional and systematic manner.

The objective of this E-Learning is to provide a fundamental understanding of the Recall Process. The learners will understand the principles of the standard, the relationship of the Recall Framework with other processes like PRIMP and CALM, the roles and responsibilities and the steps of the process.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Define what a Recall is and understand when a Recall starts;
-Recognize the importance of the Recall Process Framework in ensuring consumer safety and minimizing adverse impact to our brands and company;
-Identify how the Recall Process Framework interacts with PRIMP and CALM; and
-Identify the key roles and responsibilities in this process.

name: Sourcing Quality Management Standards Foundations E-Learning
description:
Audience: Commercial: Buyers, SQA,
All R&D, in particular Q&FS new starters, SRA, Graphics,
Supply: inbound verification, HACCP team members
Corporate Affairs: Consumer Care
Marketing: Activity Managers, All Marketing Brand Managers

Description:
Our Mars Sourcing Quality Management Standards define how we buy our materials and services, including sourcing the raw ingredients and packaging for our finished products, purchasing of premia promotional items and buying our external co-processing and co-manufacturing capabilities and our distribution network.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Describe what the sourcing quality management standards are;
-Explain why we have sourcing quality management standards;
-Describe how the SQMS four step process helps us to deliver quality;
-Describe your own role and the role of others in the application of the process; and
-Identify what you need to do next.

name: Digital Technologies Onboarding Elearning
description:
Description
Audience 

Digital Technologies Associates

 

Description 

The Digital Technologies Onboarding portal has been created for you to find all of the information that you need to navigate Digital Technologies and the Mars Global Services (MGS) organization. This course is your one-stop-shop containing information to help you understand how to navigate Digital Technologies (DT) and the IT function, and to get accustomed to our ways of working as an integrated services line in MGS.

 

Learning Objectives 

Upon completion of this course, you will:

·       Have a deeper understanding of the DT strategy and how we add value to our segment partners.

·       Understand the evolution of our organization, our success stories, and the great possibilities of our future.

tags: Data and Analytic Innovation, User Experience Design
name: Getting Started with Design Thinking E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Associates

Description:
Design Thinking can be used to explore and solve all types of problems: from how we deliver better products and services to Consumers to how we operate more effectively as a business.  Our users can change depending on the problem to solve - fellow associates, customers, consumers, pets... really anyone who would benefit from the solution you are trying to deliver!

This course will introduce Associates to Design Thinking, a creative approach to problem-solving. It is the main tool we use to become user-centric. The E-Learning will demonstrate how Design Thinking fuels innovation by bringing together what is desirable from a human point of view with what is technologically feasible and economically viable.

Upon completion of this course, you will:
-Define design thinking.
-Demonstrate design thinking as a human-centered process focusing on customers and their needs.
-Illustrate the key parts of the design-thinking process.
thumbFileUuid: Getting Started with Design Thinking E-Learning.png

tags:
Data Auditing,
Data Security,
Financial Acumen
name: Information Security Safeguarding the Audit System  E-Learning
description:
Audience: Control Owners

Description :
Before the Mars Family and the Board of Directors can rely on our financial statements, a public auditor (PwC) must provide an opinion on the accuracy and integrity of those statements. Mars IS runs an internal controls program to ensure that we maintain proper controls over the systems used to generate these statements. This module is designed to give you an overview of the importance of the Financial Audit process.

Upon completion of this course, you will:
-Demonstrate an understanding of the need for financial controls and the value it brings to Mars.
- Articulate the external risks that could leave Mars vulnerable.
-Understand at a high level how we measure the success of our financial controls as well as the role of the people involved.

name: Information Security: Offboarding for Line Managers E-learning
description:
Description:
In this course, you will examine the crucial aspects of Associate offboarding and how Line Managers, in accordance with Mars standards and procedures, safeguard the secure transfer, protection and confidentiality of  Mars data during the offboarding process.
thumbFileUuid: Information Security Offboarding for Line Managers E-learning.png

tags: Agile
name: Introduction to Agile E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Associates

Description:
This course will introduce Associates to the Agile capability and build knowledge about how and when to use it. You will learn that Agile is a way of working guided by values and principles, and is enabled by collaborative behaviors, responsive approaches, and specific tools & techniques.

By the end of this course, you will:
-Come to know the principles and practices that make Agile effective.
-Understand how Agile is leveraged to deliver better value at Mars Inc.
-Learn how Agile fits within the Five Principles.

tags: Data Analysis
name: Introduction to Data and Analytics E-learning
description:
Audience: All Associates

Description :
Journey into the world of data and analytics with our beginner-level course. Designed for associates with little to no prior experience, this course demystifies the complexities of data and analytics, shedding light on its pivotal role in work at Mars. Participants will explore fundamental concepts, tools, and practical applications, gaining a foundational understanding of how data-driven insights drive organizational success.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Define the concept of analytics and its significance in decision-making.
-Articulate the importance of data in the context of business operations.
-Appreciate how analytics contributes to organizational success and competitiveness.

name: Kanban Course Advanced E-learning
description:
Audience: All Associates

Description :
By the end of this course, you will have the ability to integrate Kanban Principles and Practices into your individual and team ways of working. You will learn how to build a Kanban System and start managing the flow of work through visualization and a service-oriented approach. Kanban is a method to manage your work!

This course was developed by the Agile Capability Team of MGS Business Change CoE.

Upon completion of this course, you will:
-Gain an understanding of the Kanban method as a part of the Agile Model - Agile Practice - at Mars.
-Be enabled to build and develop your own Kanban System for your Team.
-Understand and implement Kanban Principles and Practices in your ways of working.

Prerequisites: Agile Essentials E-Learning (Essential)

Robotic Process Automation (RPA) is a technology to consistently execute repetitive & manual tasks, freeing time to focus on more value added work. Learn more about RPA, the team that supports it at Mars and how to determine if your team is ready to hire a bot! 
Technical Information/ Requirements: requires Google Chrome to launch

name: Russian - Information Security: PCI for Credit Card Handlers E-learning
description: После завершения этого курса электронного обучения вы должны знать: «Утечки данных и мошенничество с картами являются проблемой для всех, у кого есть кредитная карта, и каждого бизнеса, который обрабатывает платежи по картам. Индустрия платежных карт (PCI) установила стандарты соответствия для минимизации рисков и защиты данных держателей карт. Марс ежегодно проверяется по этим стандартам. В этом модуле вы узнаете ключевые модели поведения и лучшие практики для безопасной обработки карточных платежей, чтобы уменьшить мошенничество с картами и обеспечить безопасность Mars и наших клиентов вместе. Этот глобальный тренинг охватывает некоторые лучшие практики для соответствия PCI на Марсе. Пожалуйста, следуйте и обсуждайте правила, политики и ресурсы с вашим линейным менеджером для конкретных бизнес-подразделений»

name: Программа: Foreign Materials Management Module 1: Introduction E-Learning
description:
Audience: All R&D, Supply and Commercial associates, especially in quality and supply chain related roles.

Description:
Foreign materials are one of the greatest quality challenges end to end in the supply chain. This short course will introduce you to foreign material management at Mars.

This is the first module of both the Foreign Materials Management and Foreign Materials Management Awareness programs.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
Describe the general risks associated with different types of foreign materials in the Mars supply chain.

Leadership Communication,
Quality and Food Safety at Mars
name: Программа: Leadership Quality Accountability Toolkit (for Senior Leaders only) Module 0: Welcome E-Learning
description:
Audience: All senior leaders enterprise wide.

Description:
As a senior leader, do you know your quality accountabilities? You are a key decision maker and are legally accountable for ensuring we provide safe and legal products and services. The decisions and actions of our Senior leaders drive behaviours down through the business to ensure that we delight our consumers, customers and clients.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
-Describe the concept of quality accountabilities and how they shape the way we do business at Mars; and
-Understand what they mean for your role and how to bring the quality principle to life as a leader at Mars.

User Experience Design
name: Программа: The Seven Magic Skills of User Centricity Module 1: Deep Empathy E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Associates

Description:
Being user-centric doesn’t just mean uncovering unmet and emerging user needs that can help us create meaningful and innovative solutions for the future. 
This course will bring clarity around User Centricity at Mars by introducing seven magic skills that, when combined, equal a truly user-centric mindset. It will give learners an overview of the fundamentals before diving into design thinking. 

Upon completion of this course, you will:
-Be able to create a positive user experience throughout their journey based on the seven skills explored.
-Acquire knowledge of the latest practices and applications used for the purpose of user-centricity.
-Evaluate the benefits of exceptional user experiences.

Управление результатом на территории при помощи цикла менеджмента.
10 электронных курсов о том, что влияет на достижение бизнес-результата и как улучшать свою результативность при сотрудничестве с нашими партнерами.
С помощью базовой теории и практических примеров вы сами пройдете через рабочие задачи сотрудников наших партнеров и научитесь давать уполномоченным представителям эффективные рекомендации и консультации для улучшения процессов и достижения бизнес-результатов.

Цикл менеджмента: Курс дает представление о менеджменте как о цикличном процессе по управлению результативностью. Данный подход широко используется и рекомендуется в различных индустриях, странах, бизнес-школах и университетах.
Универсален для любого типа руководителя/управленца (в том числе без полномочий) и дает базовое представление о результивной и логичной последовательности процессов/действий/взаимодействий для получения бизнес-результата через других людей или команды сотрудников.
Открывает цикл курсов, каждый из которых последовательно знакомит сотрудника с каждым из этапов цикла менеджента. Этот и каждый последующий курс дает сотруднику Марс представление о работе уполномоченных представителей наших партнеров и их командах с целью влияния на бизнес-результаты. Полученные знания используются для построения взаимовыгодного партнерства, осуществления эффективных бизнес-консультаций и построения и реализации эффективных совместных бизнес-планов.

Анализ и планирование: Первый этап цикла менеджмента.
Качественно и эффективное планирование комплекса действий для достижения бизнес-целей и раскрытие потенциала территории. Курc описывает цели и задачи планирования, знакомит с инструментами анализа, оперативного планирования целей и задач, приоритизации.
Основные блоки:
-Как строить долгосрочные цели и вдохновлять команду на их достижение (миссия, видение, KRA, KPI, цели)
-Принципы оперативного планирования
-Как использовать различные типы и иструменты анализа для формирования плана действий по развитию территории (GAP, SWOT, 5 почему)
-Как принимать решения при выборе альтернатив (матрица приоритизации Value-Complexity)
К-ак распределять цели во времени в зависимости от типа цели
 
После прохождения модуля вы сможете давать эффективные рекомендации уполномоченным представителям наших партнеров по процессу оперативного планирования целей, анализа результативности и составлению планов действий для достижения бизнес-результата.

Организация: С помощью этого модуля вы пройдете ключевые этапы ОРГАНИЗАЦИИ рабочих ресурсов для выполнения бизнес-задач, чтобы в дальнейшем быть способными давать практические рекомендации и проводить обучение на рабочем месте для уполномоченных представителей наших партнеров.
 
Основная тема этого модуля - РЕКРУТМЕНТ как процесс для организации необходимого в компании персонала. 
Вы узнаете об этапах и инструментах рекрутмента:
1. Планирование персонала
2. Должностная инструкция
3. Критерии кандидата
4. Поиск кандидата
5. Анализ резюме
6. Интервью и техники его проведения: Цепочки вопросов, Пример из жизни, Ролевая игра, Техника S.T.A.R, Техника 4D (структурированный подход к выявлению критериев кандидата).
Также в модуля мы кратко коснемся организации необходимых ресурсов и процессов.

Руководство: После прохождения курсов модуля Руководство вы научитесь ставить цели и задачи УП наших партнеров при индивидуальном и групповом взаимодействии, а также сможете давать рекомендации и консультации в рамках OJT для УП наших партнеров.

Обучение: Модуль дает информацию о том, как и почему обучаются взрослые люди, и как руководитель или партнер может влиять на мотивацию к обучению и результативность обучения.
Основные блоки:
-Роль менеджера в обучении сотрудников
-Принципы обучения взрослых людей
-Ситуационное руководство в обучении
-Особенности обучения в формате тренер тренера

Как обучение на рабочем месте сдалать результативным и мотивирующим? Почему важно учитывать опыт сотрудника? Всегда ли нужна обратная связь?
Этот модуль познакомит с инструментами и техникой краткосрочного развития навыков OJT для выполнения бизнес-целей.
Основные блоки:
-Модель обучения 70-20-10
-Структура тренинга на рабочем месте
-Форматы обратной связи
-Принцип составления плана развития навыка

Мотивация: модуль о том, как добиться выполнениям задач сотрудниками в хорошо и с желанием.
-Что такое мотивация, элементы мотивационного процесса и задача менеджера в мотивации
-Как связаны Цикл менеджмента, ситуационное руководство и мотивация
-Типы мотивации и структура потребностей
-Как выявить мотивацию
-Как люди воспринимают мотивационные действия менеджера/руководителя
-Как разработать мотивационную программу

Контроль и оценка: модуль покажет сотруднику, как с помощью этапов ЦМ Контроль и Оценка можно улучшать выполнение бизнес-целей и повышать мотивацию сотрудников.
Основные блоки курса:
-Что такое контроль
-Как эффективно контролировать сотрудников с разным уровнем развития
-Типы и инструменты контроля
-Аудит как главный инструмент контроля
-Что такое оценка
-Инструменты и принципы оценки
-Оценка сотрудников с разным уровнем развития (ОС)

tags:
Business Collaboration,
Commercial Acumen,
Organizational Agility, Project Management
name: Mars Project Management E-Learning
description:
Audience: All associates who are just beginning Project Management. 

Description :
Project management is the planning, delegating, motivating, monitoring, and controlling of all aspects of a project to deliver outcomes (and outputs), and to realize the benefits within expected performance targets and timelines. The focus here is on delivery, ensuring that everyone involved knows what’s expected of them, and keeping cost, time, and risk under control. Topics covered include project overviews, planning projects, roles and responsibilities, and the relationship between portfolios, programs, and projects.

Upon completion of this course, you will:
- Define basic PM concepts and explain a framework for managing projects.
- Create key deliverables in stakeholder communications and risk planning to lay the foundations for successful execution.
- Understand the difference between risk and issue.
- Explain the critical success factors for executing, controlling, and closing projects and structure the resources necessary to achieve them.
- Use appropriate project management concepts, tools & techniques to improve personal performance in role-specific project scenarios.
- Apply a set of interpersonal skills, most critically needed on projects, at critical junctures in the project life cycle.

tags:
Ethics, 
Regulatory Compliance
name: Ethics and Compliance at Mars: Doing Business with Integrity E-Learning
description:
Audience: All associates

Ты когда-нибудь чувствовал необходимость сделать что-то, что, по твоему мнению, было неправильным? Столкнувшись с необходимостью принятия трудного решения, знал ли ты, куда обратиться за помощью? Ты когда-нибудь сталкивался с ситуацией, когда правильный путь не был очевиден? Этот тренинг по соответствию этическим и правовым нормам в компании Mars призван помочь тебе определить имеющиеся ресурсы и принять правильное решение, когда ты столкнешься с такими ситуациям.

Risk Management, QMP
name: The Quality Management Process (QMP) Overview E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Associates and Contractors

Description:
The Mars Quality Management Process Overview (QMP) serves as a framework of essential quality processes and requirements for the management of quality at Mars. This course helps associates realize the importance of the Mars QMP as the global foundation for quality management.

Learning Objectives:
- Describe what the QMP is and why we need it.
- Describe key elements of the QMP.
- Describe how everyone contributes to the QMP.
- Explore what you can do yourself.
thumbFileUuid: The Quality Management Process (QMP) Overview E-Learning (Essential).png

Packaging,

Regulatory Compliance
name: Regulatory Compliance of Food Contact Materials E-Learning
description:
Audience: Associates globally and cross-segment. New SRA associates or SRA associates new to the area of food contact materials.
R&D, Packaging Developers, Commercial / SQA and Q&FS associates working on projects of qualification of Food Contact Materials.
Factory Engineering involved on the approval of factory FCM and WIP equipment.

Description:
This web-based training will help users understand the principles of regulatory compliance for Food Contact Materials.

It is relevant for associates in Commercial/SQA, Q&FS, SRA, Pack Development & Factory Engineering and will clarify the role of each associate and core responsibilities by department.

This training supports the Packaging Quality Management (PQM) Standard by focusing on the regulatory requirements for food contact materials and establishes the 'how to' for the Food Contact Materials Standard.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
- Explain the current reality and why we are checking for compliance.
- Determine what compliance means and who is responsible for it.
- Name the General Principles for Food Contact Materials (FCMs).

Safety training for Office

name: Confidential Information at Mars E-learning
description:
Audience: All associates

Description:
Защита любой конфиденциальной информации является приоритетом для корпорации Mars. Если нашим конкурентам удастся получить доступ к этой информации, то наш бизнес может оказаться под угрозой. Но что на самом деле означает термин Конфиденциальная информация?

Что может произойти, если к информации будет получен неправомерный доступ? Как можно избежать подобной ситуации?

Вне зависимости от того, являешься ли ты простым сотрудником или менеджером, раздел Конфиденциальная информация на сайте электронного обучения Mars поможет тебе понять, что является конфиденциальной информацей и предоставит указания, позволяющие предотвратить ее попадание в чужие руки.

Данный курс обязательно должны пройти все сотрудники.

tags:
Data Privacy,
Data Privacy Law,
Data Security
name: Privacy at Mars: Protecting and Securing Personal Information E- Learning
description:
Audience: All associates

Description:
This course delves into Mars' unwavering commitment to the responsible handling of personal information. Participants will gain insight into the essential practices required from each individual to ensure compliance with data privacy laws and the preservation of Mars' esteemed reputation as a trusted business.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
- Clearly articulate the concepts of data privacy and data protection, and comprehend their significance in today's data-driven world.
- Understand the reasons why data privacy is a matter of paramount importance, both legally and for maintaining Mars' reputation.
- Gain insight into the methods employed by Mars for the collection and processing of personal data.
Familiarize yourself with the principles of Data Ethics and the Mars Privacy and Security Governance Model.

tags: эффективная коммуникация, письменная коммуникация
name: Коротко и ясно. Эффективная коммуникация Virtual
description:
Audience: B4+, T1+, P1+

Description:
курс направлен на развитие навыков взаимодействия. Цель курса: отработать навык копирайтинга, то есть мастерства выражения идей и мыслей в тексте. Потому что говорят, что «think well – write well». Мы поговорим о структуре сообщения, научимся убирать лишнее, попробуем лайфхаки и сильные приемы копирайтинга на реальных ситуациях. Все это для того, чтобы сообщение «сработало» и по форме и по содержанию – и ваш собеседник согласился с вашей идеей

По итогам курса участники осваивают следующие темы:
- Структура коммуникации, особенность деловой переписки
- 7 приемов как увеличить вероятность ответа на ваше сообщение
- Структура электронного письма для различных ситуаций
- Проверка на стоп-слова 
- 3 способа, как писать в 2 раза короче и в 2 раза понятней
- Практика копирайтинга
- Обратная связь на персональный стиль письма участников
