name: E-Sourcing Parts I and II E-Learning
description:
Audience: Sourcing and Operations Associates

Description:
In this blended learning program, you will learn some of the basic principles of e-sourcing, including the benefits of eSourcing, the different types of functionality in eSourcing tools, how to prepare and manage eRequests for Information (eRFIs),  how to prepare an eRequest for Proposal (eRFP), and more. The program also covers how to prepare an e-auction and some of the basic types of e-auctions. Additionally, the program includes a simulation in which you will practice what you have learned in the two e-learnings. You will be put in a scenario and will be asked to make decisions, receiving feedback on those decisions, similar to working with a trainer.

By the end of this course, you will be able to:
- Understand the benefits of e-sourcing.
- Identify different types of functionality in e-sourcing tools.
- Build and manage eRFIs.
- Build an eRFP.
- Prepare for e-auctions.
- Gain practical knowledge of e-sourcing principles.
thumbFileUuid: Great Place to Work – Office – IMG 0212 (1).jpg

name: IEOM Introduction to the Essence of Mars - Digital Learning E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Associates

Description: 
The Introduction to Essence of Mars program is our cultural on-boarding experience for new joiners. Designed as an interactive journey, you will learn more about the three elements of our culture 'The Essence of Mars' (The Five Principles, The Associate Concept and People Leadership). The Essence of Mars is what distinguishes us as a workplace and unites and inspires us as Associates across segments, geographies and generations, ensuring that we continue to be successful as a business and as individuals. As a new Mars Associate, understanding the 'essence' of our culture will help you feel at home, understand how we work, and leverage these learnings in your own role. This learning is available in Arabic, Bulgarian, Chinese (Simplified), Chinese (Traditional), Czech, Dutch, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Indonesian, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Lithuanian, Polish, Portuguese Brazilian, Romanian, Russian, Serbian

name: Excel Basics Virtual
description:
Целевая аудитория: сотрудники R&D в России

Цель тренинга по основам MS Exce: научить вас использовать эту программу для решения задач, возникающих в нашей ежедневной работе, уверенно работать с данными, представленными в табличном виде.

Контакт: MarsUniversityRussia@effem.com

name: Anti-Corruption E-Learning
description:
Audience: All Associates

Description:
This course underscores Mars' unwavering commitment to ethical business practices by addressing the critical issue of bribery and corruption. Participants will gain a comprehensive understanding of why it is imperative to prevent these unethical behaviors and become adept at identifying common red flags. They will also learn how each individual can actively contribute to ensuring that Mars and its business partners maintain the highest ethical standards, refraining from any involvement in bribery or corruption.


By the end of this course, you will be able to:

- Articulate the details and significance of Mars' anti-corruption policy, understanding its role in upholding ethical standards.
- Understand the compelling reasons for preventing bribery and corruption in business, safeguarding Mars' reputation and integrity.
- Familiarize yourself with essential terms related to bribery and corruption that every associate should be aware of, ensuring clear communication and understanding.
- Develop the skills and knowledge to actively take steps in preventing bribery and corruption, contributing to a culture of integrity within Mars and with its business partners.

name: I&D Experience for all Associates Program
description:
Audience: All Associates, All Functions, All Segments

Description:
Learn about I&D in a personalized way and at your own pace. 

Embark on your journey toward inclusivity and diversity with the I&D Experience for All Associates program. These 15-minute training sessions will serve as a foundational introduction to key I&D concepts. Designed to resonate with your daily life, both professionally and personally, these sessions will equip you with essential knowledge to kickstart your I&D journey.

These eLearnings include a variety of I&D topics that tie into your daily life, both inside and outside of work:

I&D Navigator - Get it Together: Your guide to understanding and navigating key I&D concepts. 
Knowing me, knowing you: Uncover how people can bring their expanded selves to work.
Now we’re talking: Understand how to have productive conversations about polarizing topics.
Minus the bias: Explore how you can overcome unconscious bias.
Building bridges: Learn how to challenge everyday acts of exclusion.
Stand by me: Discover what allyship looks like and how you can overcome inequity at work.
 
You will have the possibility to earn the Inclusion & Diversity Advocate badge, which represents your dedication to learning more about this key Mars priority.

Please note: All associates must complete the I&D Navigator plus three out of the five additional modules.

name: Strategic Sourcing at Mars (MSSM) Classroom
description:
Audience: All Commercial Associates

Description:
The Mars Strategic Sourcing Methodology (MSSM) is a 6 Step process that provides Commercial associates with a clear framework of how strategic sourcing is done @ Mars. This include a set of standardized best practice tools, templates & resources

OVERVIEW: This course provides new associates with a full understanding of what is expected of them, how to use the tools and focuses on the implementation of existing strategies.

During this program, learners will have had an opportunity to:
- Understand each of the 6 steps of the MSSM and the benefits of this process for the Buyer & Mars;
- Explore basic tools a good buyer should carry out as part of his/her role; - Practice the models & tools, build on their learning & develop critical thinking skills with real life scenarios;
- Become familiar with the standard language used in Commercial in order to understand existing category strategies
- Understand how the different Job Families help and support the whole Methodology.
2 day classroom  is mandatory for all Commercial Associates.

name: Safety Pillar Onboarding E-Learning
description:
Welcome to the MSE Safety Pillar.

This course will focus on introducing you to the Pillar; specifically:
-The purpose and structure of the Pillar
-The steps required to ensure successful implementation of the Pillar at your site
-What the Pillar Team at your site should look like
-The pre-cursor requirements
